byYjwHEf44Trx0tfjit18w.text: The fried chicken was great!  They have the best collard greens I've had since I've lived in Az and the macaroni and cheese was creamy and so good.   The service was great and the staff was super friendly.  Definitely going back!

IIRXaresS8QZcHKUeEWf4A.text: This place is home.  The epitome of southern cooking.  The food is top notch.  The staff is friendly and very attentive.  So make yourself at home and stay a while.

EvGcP2DdiIiQesXrBrHCYg.text: I've been here a couple of times and the food has been great. The chicken is fired just right and is so juicy and tender. The mac and cheese is delicious. Their sweet tea hits the spot. My only gripe here is the decor off the place. It's looks like it could be spruced up a bit.

AB7itXRkc5HmLkVigNRLZA.text: Never again.  The actual restaurant was absolutely filthy and the staff was super slow and had an excuse for why everything was behind.  I sat in a booth that was broken and everything on the menu, magazines, picture frames, table, and wall that butted up against the table had grease splattered all over them ...yuck.  The walls were dirty.     The entree food was very greasy and tasted mediocre.  The piping hot temperatures took away from the flavor.  The peach cobbler was tasty, but not necessarily any better than how one might expect a decent peach cobbler to taste.

XXAFngdVZTBdT9pGd-PXkA.text: Want authentic soul food? This is the place for it. We had a great time - the food was amazing, loved seeing all the writing on the walls, and the staff was super friendly. This place is a repeat to me for sure!

qa03s_e25wel7qEZaZuODw.text: AMAZING food AMAZING service. Anyone who gives this place a bad rating is just crazy. Would recommend this place to anyone. Definitely coming back!!!

Rx11ND9mHgFtZznn0BKlkA.text: Greeeaaat food!  Nothing like southern home cooking.  Thank you Doris and Carlos for your hospitality

5EKIkzUBFM6gPOHhJv--jg.text: Another great trip to Mrs. White's!  Had the southern fried chicken with mixed greens and Mac n cheese.  Everything was fresh and crispy. Chicken was crunchy but not greasy and the greens, well they were phenomenal!!!  Mac n cheese is always creamy but not runny like some. Washed down with a great glass of red kool aid and I drove home drowsy!!!   Thanks again to the staff!!!

wxSWz_KB7LJQPj0cXNGDgQ.text: Both times we've been there the food was amazing!  Keep in mind if you're concerned with ambiance & great service this isn't the place for you.  Just plan on overlooking or not caring about great service because the food is DELICIOUS! The chicken fried steak is the absolute best we've ever had, the mac & cheese is amazing as well as their known favs fried chicken & pork chops.

0gh73EACYHcJ2_0RDD-oqA.text: Not only was the food amazing here. It was so great to have the story with a picture book told to us by our waitress. She was kind hearted. She loves her job you can tell. She told the story about the business with so much love and heart. The guy with all the tattoos like myself. It's amazing to see people not judging him and he loves his job as well. We own Rusk Lock & Key. And I run the marketing team for my husbands locksmith business and it's hard to work not knowing if people are going to judge with tattoo like myself. And I find it very cool to see businesses hiring people with tattos. Because he cares about his job. Thats the type of people you want working for you

D98yuE1kWYhOVr86Xnz6XQ.text: This place used to be so good, not anymore.  We went on sunday and waited an hour for dry small fried chicken.  They were out of many items we ordered.  We felt very bad for the server who had to deal with many customers.

IEJzdEYaCQDHftln12dlOQ.text: Great stuff. Will not leave hungry or didappointed. Get the pork chops and mac n cheese!  Word of caution: you may need a designated driver. No alcohol, just a great food induced fatigue.

aB1IHyPlwkvSFT2E0uFSbw.text: This is the worst place I have ever came to eat! Honestly I don't care about the food tasting "good" when the service is horrible! Ide rather pay for mediocre food and have friendly non racist servers! My husband and I came in (he's black im Mexican) and the server right away just told us to sit down anywhere and came to get our drink orders soon after two more people came in after and she took their order first!!! Left us hanging! It wasn't until I told My husband what she had done that he got her attention and had to yell across the room that we were ready to order she right away looked at my like she knew what she did . She came to take our order and took my husbands first and then I ordered and she pretended i didnt say anything! She said "are you going to get your order?!" With and attitude I responded I had just told her my order she responded with a oh I couldn't hear you! And the food took forever to come out! Honestly I could care less about the food after all this crap! I wish yelp had a negative star review!

Rb-a_8vbJLQxPDuf_NvY6A.text: This is old school food in an old school building. You can almost glimpse the Phoenix of days gone by and it kind of makes you feel good to know something has withstood the test of time and the rush to make corporate eateries seem small time local (Postinos, the Yard etc.) This place is small time local and you can tell from the food and service.  Key things to note:  Menu is heavy southern fare - so come hungry Entrees are $13-15 including 2 sides Sandwiches are around $6 and have one side No alcohol Credit cards accepted You follow the golden rule and honestly report what you ordered when you pay They close at 7pm  My friend and I opted for sitting at the counter. Only complaint is the chairs were horribly uncomfortable. Being closer to the kitchen and staff you could see this is a family place and everyone takes care of each other. Staff was very pleasant. Bridget took good care of us.  Both our main dishes were delicious. One catfish and one fried chicken. The green beans were good as was the mixed greens.   I read some of the bad reviews on this place and most seem unfair or specific to one encounter. Do not go into this place expecting glitz or a modern slick feel that so many "hip" restaurants in Phoenix have of late. This is a family run establishment that serves old fashioned food. Respect who they are and what they are doing and you'll have a good experience. If not, go wait 3 hours for a pizza at Bianco's down the road.

aqgmI_Ym5S6qWaVdLkU1VA.text: Yes! I am giving it a 1 star.   I think I am a bit biased though because I have had Sweetie Pie's (being as I'm from STL) so I know good soul food PLUS my aunt owns a bakery and is a awesome cook when it comes to southern food.   This place? Absolutely NOT! The meals should NOT be 15 a plate.. it's not worth it at all. People always put this place on a high pedal stool and I don't know why. Me and my BF decided to try this place on a whim and I was greatly disappointed. I got the smothered pork chops... cold, bland, and looked old. Let's not even get on the corn bread... super dry! I seriously don't think this place is worth 15 bucks a plate.   On the other hand Lo Lo's (DOWNTOWN location) it's GOOD! So good when my cousin was in town for a day I suggested this place of ALL places I know. And she is a harsh critic but she approved! I know for a fact she would not approve of this place. Neither do I.   Thing is... this place is owned by Ms. White and Lo Lo's is owned by I think her grandson or something so you would THINK the food and the way it taste would kinda coincide.

photos.caption: Photo of Mrs White's Golden Rule Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. This is not worth 15 dollars a plate. It taste just how it looks.

unMKRkjhpEpeUSZtK2FzXg.text: Great southern style Soul food. Chicken was moist and the mac-n-cheese was hot and flavorful. Throw away your "count the calories" cuz it's all about "Yea Baby"! when you take a bite of the chicken.

PjPPvmmKgZJ3qCJ2K4yoXA.text: Went back to Mrs. White's for lunch yesterday.  The food is to die for, best fried chicken this side of the Mississippi, & the Mac & Cheese melts in your mouth.  What I love just as much is the friendly staff, they remember your face, make sure you feel welcome & go out of their way to make sure your food is right.  We took 2 people who had never been there before with us & both said they can't wait to go back again.  Do not head there if you are in a hurry, good food & good friends take time. This is not upscale froufrou food, this is good for the SOUL food, like eating dinner at your best friend's (or Gramma's) house!

UVYyIFbXUVas-cyrHQ5ksA.text: I came in with my friend who hyped it up. I had high hopes for the Mac n cheese and ordered the cobbler first. Which had what looked like a hair. Which was apparently from a brush the waiter put it in his mouth to prove it wasn't a hair  they brought the food it was way too salty and the macaroni in the mac and cheese was over cooked. They used cheese sauce and not cheddar cheese to my disappointment it resembled KFC Mac and cheese. I ordered a sandwich which ended up being just a piece of country fried chicken in sauce no bread. I asked the  waitresses if I could get the bread and she asked if I wanted bread or corn bread I enthusiastically said corn bread which didn't come ever until my friend went and asked for it. Which all together took about 30 minutes. All together the service was horrible the food not very good. I tasted the greens which were tasty.  Ultimately I was disappointed on top of that I got over changed. But I decided to just call it a night.   They didn't seem to care too much about anything.   I most likely won't go back again. And it sucks. I really wanted to like this place but it just didn't happen.

nQVkrX1cmtd-uPLstudqdw.text: I always make a point of visiting a Fried Chicken place every time I am in a new US City and Mrs White's was up there with the best! I ordered the Golden Fried chicken which came with 3 pieces of chicken and 2 sides and smashed it down. Bit too expensive for me to give 5 stars (it came to nearly $14) but still a good place to go for a treat.

l26NIYwG4sKM1PvmYN1Q9g.text: Stopped by one Sunday morning around 11am.  I was the first customer there so I was looking forward to fast service and hot food.  I ordered the chicken, sweet potatoes, mac and cheese with cornbread.  The chicken was great, crunchy nicely seasoned and the portion was large.  Thus the 2 stars.  Everything else was unimpressive, mac and cheese was not creamy, potatoes were off, still cant put my finger on what it was but not good.  The cornbread was dry and had no flavor.  The atmosphere was blah, looked dirty, and the food should have made up for it and didn't.  Can't say I will try it again.

vdMhcOqQJhtUtFppFPMAdA.text: Amazing fried chicken! The staff is friendly and welcoming. They have kids' meals, which include fried chicken, one side (macaroni and cheese was a favorite), and drink.  My kids can't stop raving about it! My chicken fried steak was delicious and the gravy was perfect-smooth and creamy. We will be sure to stop in the next time we are in Phoenix. Thank you!

fsHW2KGJuIvUxU3Ewv3OtQ.text: I've eaten here many times over the past 6 years and absolutely loved the food every time.  Never had better fried pork chops anywhere...sweet potatoes are awesome too!  I've been bragging about this place to my family out of state for years....while the family was in town yesterday, we stopped in for lunch anticipating a wonderful meal.  There were only two booths seated when we arrived...the two young men that waited on us were pleasant and attentive, but the meal we got was just ok.  The moist succulent (fried) pork chops were not either.  Typically you get two nice bone in center cut pork chops that are juicy on the inside and crunchy on the outside.  What we got were two chops (one boneless chop and one super thin bone in chop). One was tasty and one like jerky.  Sweet potatoes and greens were great, gravy on rice was watery and flavorless, same with potatoes and green beans.  Corn bread was served cold and chewy, not made that day.  Things have changed and not for the better....they have never been known for their service, but the food had been so good I was willing to overlook this.  I hope this was just a fluke and the once wonderful food returns soon!

T2HeCwSqDD-aXLPoYc21BA.text: I went to the establishment as a expert of soul food.  If Mrs White's was anywhere in the south, it would not have gotten any accolades.  Don't get me wrong.  The fried chicken was good, with a perfect texture and crunchy outside.  And if I was only grading it on the chicken, she would have been "movin on up" status but the mac and cheese was a poor excuse.  Bland and as close to store bought without purchasing from KFC as you can get.  The red beans and rice were worse.  But what was I expecting in Phoenix as far as soul food goes?  I have seen 3 african americans since arriving to PHX and 2 worked at Mrs Whites.  I suggest sticking to the tex-mex...

4O9hNbP17Hdy-zLml9rHrQ.text: I spent many formative years in Eastern North Carolina & I can certainly appreciate some good home cooking - this place definitely satisfies that craving. I had the most amazing smother/friend pork chops (their seasoning is delish), mixed greens & black eyed peas - sweet tea and the only reason I can't give more stars is because they were out of the peach cobbler I have heard so many great things about - however, the apple pie I had instead was definitely yummy. I plan to make this a reg spot once I move uptown - :)

DDqAQvc6hsH8i8cHDugdVw.text: I love me some Mrs. White's. It's been a few years since I've eaten here and boy have I missed this place and their delicous food. On my recent visit I ordered the catfish with green beans and okra gumbo (a Friday only special) and to drink sweet tea. The sweet tea was just right. It wasn't overly sweet, it was perfect.  The food was just as great as I remembered. The catfish was seasoned just right. The okra gumbo was yummy with lots of okra, black eyed peas and corn. I had remembered that the menu was written on the wall, but to my surprise they had printed menus.  I noticed that they seem to be open on weekends now which is awesome because now I can enjoy Mrs. White's more often.

qe0h4uEZsxirpDtJp_yMXw.text: FANTASTIC!!!  This place left me feeling fat & happy!!  We originally were heading some place else, they were closed, then we headed to a second option which had an hour & 1/2 wait, so third time's a charm, and we found Mrs. White's!!  This place is an old, small, mom & pop diner, but the love in the kitchen is there.  Everyone was friendly, from the guy in the parking lot taking a break, to the wait staff, & even the cook came out to see how everything was.  The most fantastic, rib sticking, cornbread came with the meal.  We ordered catfish, green beans, mac n' cheese, smothered pork chops, gravy n' rice, fried okra, & a hot link.  Everthing came out hot, hot, hot & was delicious!  My boyfriend even finished my plate.  We will definitely be visiting again.  The food was 4.75 stars - I didn't care for my rice & gravy.  My only con of this place was the decor felt dirty, & the bathrooms were hot as hell.  I didn't mind the graffiti signed walls, it gives the place character & allows the patrons to participate in a little bit of history.  I can't wait to go back & try other items on their menu.

fcRF_zJebum-DYtG704p5g.text: Good fried chicken, not the best though.  DDD, you've disappoint me.  I went to this restaurant because it was featured on the Food Network channel.  I should have left when I walked in and saw the "dining room."  And when I say "dining room," I mean a dirty, take-out, greasy space with small tables that looked like they were thrown away by the public schools cafeteria.  But hey, at least I can say that I gave it a shot.

mRP6VGqr2azSbeKp7rPnig.text: We came there on November 5, 2011 and the service was very bad. The worst I have ever seen and we were treated like shit. We came into town from LA and Vegas for the NFL game and seen Mrs. White's cafe on Foodnet Work and knew the food had to be great. The chicken was great, but the customer service was so bad we will never return again.  We got a refill on our drinks and the guy poured sum of our drinks on the left overs so we could not take our food back to the hotel. Foodnet Work shame on you for recommending this place. Just because the chicken is good, does not mean you treat people like shit.   We had to remind the staff over six times to get our order. We waited over 40 minutes to get the other 3 pieces of chicken to finish our meal. We don't mind waiting but it was pretty rude when you are watching other peolple are getting their meals when they walked in after us. The Mac and Cheese did not look like everyone else's order- it look like it came out of a box. You can tell it was far from homemade, it cleary was not bake, no crust. The gravy was watered, missing favor. Corn bread was over cooked under salted. The cornbread sure as  hell did not look like everyones else's cornbread. I felt like we received the leftovers.   Truly the worst service we ever received. The place needs to learn how to be respectful and just be nice.

0UPYadT1MuD4vL24HZUVxg.text: First, all lunches are $13.00 each plus $2.15 for drinks. Too expensive for lunch.  The green beans/potatos and rice wer very good.  Generous  quantities.   the chicken was miserabe. over cooked, dry, the crust was almost without flavor,.  There no redeaming factors. If this is True soul food, I am not doing soul again.

j3fSWulRykZWv4qmd4AMyg.text: The topic of Mrs Whites would frequently come up in the office place by a coworker who used to work near there, at the New Times. This past week though it came up quite often, often enough that on Monday, when we were planning our lunch out together for Thursday, we were so hungry by talking about Mrs Whites that it only took until shortly after 11 for us to pile in her car and head out for some good ol' soul food.   I can't even begin to tell you how wonderful this place is. It's like walking into Grandma's kitchen and getting all those great meals you used to love and enjoy. My mouth was watering and my stomach was singing before I even had a chance to sit down.   I like that all the meals are the same price. It makes it so much easier. I also like the selection of sides and dishes. The red kool-aid was delicious but not in a mason jar like Lolos.  The staff was very friendly. One of my coworkers was craving ox tail and it started a big discussion between us and our waitress. She mentioned that Mr. Larry might know when it was available again (they were apparently out of it that day) and he even came out to the table to talk to us. My friend also then got his ox tail. I tried it. It's really damn good. I'd probably order it if it was available the next time I came around.  I went for the 3 piece smothered chicken (fried chicken and gravy) and red beans and rice. Wow that is a lot of food. I devoured the chicken fairly quickly. It was delicious. Best friend chicken I've had aside from my Grandma's. The red beans and rice I had to package up and bring home. I had them for dinner tonight and they were just as delicious as I imagined.   I also tasted one bite of the peach cobbler a la mode. Peaches are not one of my favorite fruits but damn did they do it right.   If you haven't been here, it's a definite must. I'm not sure why you're still reading this. Pack up and go. Move it.

i4pkQPnfTANCMx8O1Z3-2g.text: Visited again but seemed the menu is limited during the weekday.

GSN_4eeEr2W16z1JK9arWw.text: I have vascillated on Mrs. White's for a few years now. Today's visit sealed the deal for me on why I won't return.   I got a to-go order of fried chicken, black eye peas and rice with gravy (since they were out of mac & cheese at 11:30 am). As I waited for my order, I watched several plates of chicken being delivered to customers eating in. The pieces were so huge they were half falling off the plates and towering above them. I looked forward to the same as I drove home, especially since I paid $14.81 for my lunch- and that did not include a beverage. Imagine my dismay as I opened my box at home and discovered three tiny pieces of underseasoned not-so-fresh tasting chicken. What the hell? You give the sit down customers the best you have to offer because they might complain otherwise? You give me some bullshit chicken because I am doing carryout? The peas were mush, the rice & gravy was bland, and the cornbread was overdone on the outside and heavy and underdone inside. I guess you're overcharging your customers to bank-roll your retirement, which will surely come sooner rather than later since I can't imagine how you're keeping customers.

g77XAx0-CUOGTqBusAUMmw.text: Oh my god.  Seriously.  The fried chicken is so light and crisp, I thought this dead bird was going to fly right off my plate.  The collard greens--you'll want to slap someone for serving you greens that didn't taste like this.  They are a gift from on high, and the black eyed peas are insanely good.  Redolent with pork and seasoning, they trump any black eyed pea you have ever had.    Cornbread is grilled and isn't the dry, crumbly, cakey crap some places have the gall to give you, and the macaroni and cheese is soupy, cheesy and perfectly cooked, just like you wanted.  I saw plates literally overflowing with smothered pork chops and chicken, and if I hadn't been full to the point of a coma after eating all the chicken and greens and mac and cheese I could hold, I would have ordered some.  Or catfish.  Or neck bones.    Desserts offered by one of the ladies who cooks walking through the dining room going "Who's gonna have peach cobbler?".  Who??? ME!  That's who!  Peach cobbler...are you kidding?  Do people say no??  Meals are ONE PRICE, period, ($10.18 with two sides and cornbread)and you better bring cash.  The lemonade was excellent ($2.37).  Oh my god, what wouldn't I have given to be a cow, with four stomachs.  It's worth going back to Phoenix for.  Stop here before you drop off your rental car.  You'll thank me.  So will your cardiologist.

z4hbKvlK21jVIvSfHxWBaA.text: Whenever I feel the urge for a gravy fix, I head straight over to Mrs. White's. I almost always order the pork chops - smothered. OMG gravy goodness running all over the plate! As for the sides, just pick one - they are ALL good!   There isn't much that I can add to the other reviews, except that I have actually called Mrs. White's before holiday potlucks and had them whip up some extra cornbread for me to take. They always seem a little tickled at the request, but have never refused and it allows me to focus on the festivities (not to mention everyone expects it now).  If you are looking for really good food in a unique and relaxed setting Mrs. White's Golden Rule Cafe should not be missed.

BPeEW0U3PW4hpvEllLvhYg.text: I went to visit my daughter in Phoenix, I search Yelp to find a good restaurant to take her to since she is new to the area.  I came across Mrs. Whites and read all of the GOOD reviews!  Boy o Boy was I VERY disappointed.  I did not find the chicken good at all, service was slow and the plates came out one at a time minutes apart.  It was Friday night 10/21/11 abt 9pm and they were out of a couple of dishes.  When I think of Kool-aid (growing up Black) i think of it as flavorful and to be honest, a little too sweet. It was neither.  I had the chicken with sweet potatos and cabbage, the cabbage looked nice but was, oh so bland, i did like the sweet potatos.  To be fair let me tell you what my boyfriend and daughter thought...they LOVED the chicken.  So to each his own, they are not writing this review.  I would not go to this place again

WhaOmwP2Swp_csAPDpRpag.text: The fried chicken is awesome and the portion sizes are huge. The only thing I didn't like was the peach cobbler. It was like eating peach soup because it was watered down.

QgmFNpZ9YWekAVXkfCziqA.text: First off I would like to punch the dip Shit on the food network who said this was the best chicken he ever ate. Yeah the place is filthy, but how they operate their business is redicolus. Service sucks, 49 minute wait for the food sucks, waiting 20 minutes from the first  entree being dropped off until the last person luckily receives their food sucks, being told on the 59th minute of a hour wait for your food, that they are out of your side dishes, sucks, spending my hard earned money at a place that is Ass backwards in any kind of business sense, sucks. At first our group thought it was a joke, then the reverse racism theory was brought up, then we noticed that every table was experiencing the same lack of service. Black, white, purple,orange. They just sucked.

HVPxcYhWVJdUO2WvEShAsQ.text: Had the pork chops, which were very good.  Meat was tender and the gravy smooth and tasty.  Had the mixed greens and sweet potatoes for sides.  Greens were cooked well and spiced, the sweet potatoes melted in your mouth. Good food, try it.

rH8TUe0kAprMC4gDWs3esA.text: Mrs. White's is the biggety bomb!   I don't know how else to say it. I can't believe there was only one review so far. This place deserves better!  If you like southern aka food, this is the spot. It is 100% authentic.  My favorites - anything on the menu.  The collard greens are perfect.  The okra gumbo is perfect.  The fried chicken, plain or smothered (in gravy) are perfect.  The pork chops are perfect. Just don't tell my Rabbi I said that. ;)  The catfish is perfect. DOn't tell my Rabbi about that one, either, mmkay?  The cornbread is perfect.  The red beans and rice... perfect.  Starting to see a pattern here?  A few tips:  Get there early. They start to run out of stuff if you show up too late.  You can order a meal and then things by the piece. Like, order the catfish and a chicken thigh or something.   They don't have soda. They do have tea. Sweet tea (already sweetened - too sweet for me but very authentic southern) or unsweetened.  Order extra cornbread. It comes with the meal but you'll thank me.  If you don't have room for dessert, get it to go. The peach or whatever cobbler they have is kick ass, as is the bread pudding.  You will get seated and then order. They don't bring a bill to your table, you go up to the counter when you're done, tell them what you ordered, and pay there. That's why it's called the 'Mrs Whites Golden Rule.' Make sure to leave a good tip. They deserve it.  Being a regular will get you better service, but you aren't going there for the service. You're going there to eat.   There's a good chance you'll spot some Phoenix sports stars. I don't know who they are because I don't follow sports, but you can pretty much pick em out.  They are only open for lunch.   That's pretty much all you need to know. Bring your friends or coworkers, enjoy, and plan to endure a 3 hour food-induced coma when you're done.

YBsnbrxOmZsCINL34nVuEA.text: I have been to Mrs. White's twice now and I'm definitely looking forward to my next visit.  My first time I ordered the cat fish.  It was good, but really needed to douse it in hot sauce to really enjoy it.  My husband ordered the smothered pork chops only because they didn't have any fried chicken available.  I was really bummed since the fried chicken was really all that I wanted.  Service is friendly and fairly quick.  On our second visit we had the fried chicken.  I'm hoping our first visit was a fluke because the flavor and crunch on their fried chicken is to die for! We also ordered oxtail, which I had only ever tried served in a peanut butter stew (Filipino dish).  Don't let the looks fool you.  Their oxtail is so flavorful and tender.  Deelish!  For sides I had rice with gravy and greens.  You have to order the greens as a side!  I think it compliments any of their entrees.  My husband was disappointed to find that they were out of okra on this visit.  It seems that there is always something not available when we go.  I'm not too bothered by it.  I think of it as someone's home kitchen.  You eat what's available and it's almost certainly going to be comforting and delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of Mrs White's Golden Rule Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Oxtail with greens and rice and gravy

FbDqbgPtzpr6wZ0xxmKdBg.text: I went online to find out when they open and the website said 10:30. I arrive and someone is out back peeling potatoes. I asked when they are open and he says 10:30. I go to the front door and it is locked. I go back to my car and the guy peeling potatoes is gone. I drive around to try to find another restaurant that's open. I can't find another restaurant that's open so I wind up coming back to Mrs. White's. They are open now and I go inside and take a seat at the counter. No one is inside, no customers nor employees. A waitress comes from the back and takes my order. I ordered chicken fried steak it takes a long time to come out and when it does it go to someone else. There's a mixup and the waitress said that she can make my steak in  just 10 minutes I agree to the additional 10 minutes. I asked for a soda and and and informed that they do not sell sodas anymore. Only lemonade and Iced Tea that they make. I asked for a pepper based vinegar sauce that they used to have and they no longer have it. She finally brought my chicken fried steak up and it was very soggy like smothered steak. When I was done with the meal I was brought  a piece of cornbread that look like a golden nugget and was as hard as one. Literally, it was crystalline and you could have cracked a tooth on it. It looks like Mrs. White's has been sold to someone else and management and the employees and the cooks have changed. It's not the same as it used to be. Go and find out for yourself but I think it went downhill.

rTXJHDLxW-zbA7WUkjytYQ.text: Excellent soul food!!  Mrs Whites serves up amazing soul food which gets then 5 stars in my book. There is nothing elegant about the restaurant. The menu was written on the wall with magic marker and their signatures from happy patrons all over the walls. I have been going here for years and I must say that the service has improved drastically and they now also take credit cards which is a plus. I love all of the sides so much that I always order the vegetable plate which consists of as many of the side items as will fit on one plate.  From fried chicken to smothered pork chops to chicken fried steak- it's all delicious.  The cornbread is also outstanding and if you somehow have enough room you can enjoy one of their amazing desserts or give it to go and enjoy it later after you're done with your food coma.  The sweet tea, lemonade, and super sweet koolaid are excellent for washing down the food.   The transportation and parking situation is a little challenging due to the close proximity to the light rail and the congested downtown area. If you can score a parking spot in their small parking lot that is the way to go. The lunch rush can be difficult and time consuming, but it's worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Mrs White's Golden Rule Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. A gigantic plate of vegetable goodness! Pre-hot sauce
Photo of Mrs White's Golden Rule Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fried chicken with black eyed pea&#39;s and green beans and potatoes
Photo of Mrs White's Golden Rule Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Delicious cornbread

TWgMEihIw8eBwMBRFyF9uw.text: I'm so disappointed. I've come here several times but my last two times were terrible.  Last time my Mac and cheese taste burnt and my greens tasted like someone accidentally dropped all the salt in them. This time I was charged for two sides but didn't get my second side (Mac and cheese). Sucks cause when the food is good, it's good. This place is just hit or miss.

Photo of Mrs White's Golden Rule Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States

DTI6f4xPcNrVJ_lo5ssd1w.text: Fantastic food that reminds me of the food my grandma cooked for me as a kid.  Catfish and fried chicken are excellent but the oxtail is in rivaled bliss.

499wOOJLb1Hk09wy5zswNA.text: Service takes a minute so chill. They're not in a rush.   Food tastes homemade and isn't loaded with sodium so go here if you don't want the itis from eating at Lolo's. #botharebombthough   Can't go wrong with fried catfish or the fried chicken. Their side options are simple but simple & delicious, similar to boston market sides minus the processed taste.   Been meaning to try their chicken fried steak for a while but they close hecka early. Biggest con.   This place isn't going to WOW you, but  If you're craving fried chix or a thanksgiving plate during the day, this place is a solid option.

r7YAr8gf4dNOl2gJdqNS7Q.text: My friend recommended it and it was worth the half hour drive!  Will definitely be back.  The employees are incredible and the food is absolutely amazing.  I would say that some more cleaning would be nice.

ofjKI_VdSRoxjhSD03rRTA.text: Let's just say, after living in Phoenix for almost two years, I finally felt at home.

V-DIJCLrY63D9XFLmFbuUQ.text: We didn't eat here, but used the parking lot; $10 for Friday and $15 for Saturday. Sunday would've been $20 but we didn't go then. Just a few blocks from the 'Con...worth it!

Nz-IEobKOxWXg4xS0qojDw.text: Good Lord!!! Good greasy, grandma tasting, filling, soul food. Seriously good. The items are made daily so it's likely your favorite dish maybe be sold out by time evening comes.   My significant other and I had Mrs. Whites Monday night. He was craving something filling and filling, I wanted Mac and cheese.   On a Monday there were about 5 couples dining, including us. I ordered smothered chicken with Mac and cheese and green beans win potatoes. It came with 3 huge pieces of chicken. He ordered ox tails, sweet potatoes, and rice and gravy. Both dishes came with cornbread. The ox tails were cooked to perfection, very little fat, very meaty. OMG!!! Delicious!! I've probably had Mrs. Whites only 3 times since I've been in the valley (almost 3 years). It's definitely something you shouldn't be eating all the time, but when you want some go ole fashioned, filling soul food. You better head to Mrs. Whites.

r-UkYhXKQSOKwxxGEM-Aew.text: Absolutely amazing! Great atmosphere, friendly people and amazing food! I drove an hour round trip just to get a chicken dinner and it was so worth it!

0QiRjMp-arEqKfayPBNztA.text: Yessss!!! The black eye peas were flavorful. When i looked at them I thought this juice is watery. I dont see no meat. I was joyfully surprised they were good. The cornbread has the consistency of cornbread that had been microwaved wayyyy too long. The fried chicken was good seasoned but not a lot of salt. The Mac N Cheese was good also. Overall I will go back and try their pork chops I know I wont be disappointed. I recommend for sure. You have to try the kool aid lol

ew9S_uVzDLa97p7P539E1A.text: Stopped into Mrs. White's Golden Rule the first time in a few years. This local joint has been a staple in Phoenix since 1964!!  I use to stop in here several times a year when working in the downtown area.  Today I opted for the same dish I use to always get: Catfish, rice w/gravy, and green beans w/ potatoes.  Just as good as I remembered and what I was hoping for.  Portion sizes are smaller than they once were but are now a perfect portion size for a full meal. Catfish had a good crunch with the fish still being moist and tender. The gravy could use some more salt & pepper but the green beans with potatoes were great.  Decor wise: this restaurant is about as simple as it gets. Plating is also simple but has improved over the years. The real star here is the food as it should be. Highly recommended this Phoenix staple when in the downtown area.

photos.caption: Photo of Mrs White's Golden Rule Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Catfish, rice w/gravy, and green beans w/potatoes.

_FO2dZQCjh65dOloSLi5Yg.text: DOWN HOME DOWN HOME DOWN HOME SOUL FOOD! One of the best ever! From beginning to the end, every food entree, so delicious! You will really have a good time with friends & family sitting around the table with the comfort of Mrs. White Smother porkchops fried chicken ribs collard greens cabbage macaroni and cheese cornbread and a course for dessert peach cobbler pie so good, good, good! FOR REAL! REAL! REAL!  PLUS YOU GET A NICE SIZE OF SERVING.

pjjoM68ftoU9uvZc71sXaw.text: The 2 piece chicken entree consisted of a back and a wing.  I'd have been okay with that if the price hadn't been $13!  Service was slow, at 1:20 pm the ice tea and cole slaw "hadn't been made yet."  The fried okra arrived after we were done eating.

1jz5czSjLBBoZl4skezmbQ.text: The Service from the waiters is below average ... they are not polite at all, they are nonchalant about issues patrons had with their food wait times... I even heard the waiter argue  with a table saying he's just the waiter and not the cook. the Mac n cheese is artificial and NOT homemade and looks and tastes identical to KFC Mac n cheese, it's Super yellow in color which would not be the case had it been homemade. I'm southern and the food is subpar. The yams were dry, the greens were ok there was no meat in them though ... the catfish was great though... And it was hot as hell in there...I know it's cooling down outside but the place is tiny and packed... I'm from the south so this place did not meet my expectations by far.

yvHV9JuP6PtgyOfWxoh2Sw.text: I can't understand any review of less than a 5 for Mrs Whites! We love the food so much we had our wedding rehearsal dinner there!! Get the smothered chops and the rice with gravy - you won't regret it!

DlifbXBx2PiCqSyUs00aWA.text: Smothered porkchop was great. Environment reminds me of a country old joint mom and pops shop. I reccomend.  Very authentic look n originality

7mNpwqHdy9BZtesWwfVtOQ.text: The fried chicken is simply incredible, possibly outdone only by the smothered pork chops which were among the most delicious thing I've ever eaten! The chicken fried steak was also good but nowhere near the rest. Sides are fresh and just about everything is a good choice but the sweet potatoes were addictively awesome.   Servers were very attentive and friendly. I did get a weird feeling when paying after getting absolutely no response to signing the credit card slip and leaving a 20% tip. The gentleman who seemed initially full of smiles very obviously examined the tip line then set down the slip and gave us no further acknowledgement as we turned away and left. It just felt weird and was an unfortunate closing experience.

Jz3EmA9b6KdZC3AmojW-Uw.text: Terrific soul food!  They were out of chicken.  So we have to come back.  This pic is what the table should look like when you're done!

7Mx7c6yuvbaEJ0XYx7zrBg.text: Great service, I liked the taste of the fried chicken and pork, it was moist and succulent. The collard greens were good, the macaroni was kind of dry. I think it's a little overpriced, but overall a good experience

OjzBqVcJjU1NuQROIIOpBw.text: Best friend chicken, greens, cole slaw. Friendly staff a bit slow relaxed service so don't come if you're in a hurry. Completely worth the wait.

167jsZiqStENz_qU4HyK1A.text: As I've heard many say before, if your not looking for this place you would easily pass it, and while that is True, I'm glad I was looking for it! This place is a hidden gem, awesome home cooking type would food. If your looking for awesome service with an aesthetically pleasing decor this is not the place. With that said, our server was very polite and attentive despite what some of these other reviews on Yelp have said about the service. Our food came out in a timely manner, especially for items like these that are cooked to order. The fried chicken was fantastic, and authentic to a home cooked soul food meal. The sweet potatoes were great, not too sweet with just a touch of cinnamon and brown sugar flavor. The Smothered pork chips were awesome and my pregnant belly was very very pleased with them! The green beans were also soul food style green beans and exactly what I wanted and would have expected. The mac n cheese was also great, again home cooking soul food style. All these reviews on here that complained about the food looking like slop I think is just silly and clearly they don't understand what home cooking soul food looks like. This is a hole in the wall mom n pop place. Soul food isn't particularly aesthetically pleasing food so to expect it to look like a trendy restaurant in old town's food would look is just silly. Close your eyes and taste the food if you need your food to look like something off of top chef. I enjoy a fun trendy restaurant as much as the next foodie but I also enjoy a hole in the wall mom n pop and this fits that bill. The amount of food you get for the price is awesome, if you think this is pricey then I guess you should stick to the fast food dollar menu. Oh and the kool aid and corn bread was on point as well! We will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Mrs White's Golden Rule Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Kool aid... On point!
Photo of Mrs White's Golden Rule Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Corn bread and kool aid.. What could be better!
Photo of Mrs White's Golden Rule Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Smothered pork chops, fried chicken, Cole slaw, sweet potatoes, Mac n cheese and green beans.. Everything was fantastic.

cFruEMGE4BMevszPm3Ug5w.text: Taking a bite of their sweet potatoes is like taking a bite out of heaven. Their chicken is fried to perfection and their Cobbler was made to a standard that only Chuck Norris could possibly compete with.

9tqQpQmhJJMz93hiAJf16w.text: Having heard so much about Mrs. Whites, had to try it.  Known for its Fried Chicken, on my first trip I asked the Counter Waitress (very helpful by the way) what she suggested and she said "The Pork Chop." Well I came for the Fried Chicken so she suggested a "Combination Plate" with both. Glad she did!  The Pork Chop, thin and apparently pan fried was absolutely TERRIFIC! If I could have, I would have eaten the bone! Obviously a combination of coating and temperature, which is able to partially caramelize the small amount of fat on the Pork Chop, make it delectable. The Fried Chicken was a bit of a disappointment on both occasions. NOT the best I have had and honestly, I could almost do as well at home. Additionally, the breast piece (on both occasions) was anemic without much meat and skin. Sides? Mac and Cheese and the Cabbage are addictive. The best? CORNBREAD! Wonderful, hot, full of flavor and no butter is needed.  NOT a bargain at $13 without a drink for lunch (they are only open until 7 PM) but lots of choices besides the Pork Chop and Fried Chicken.

omTmPJPJcS6Zk2TUTl-l1w.text: The chicken and sweet potatoes were good. The corn bread was terrible. I loved their cornbread years ago and couldn't wait to eat it when my co-workers went for lunch. It was terrible and stale. It is definitely not the same. Me and my co-workers went for lunch and placed a to go order. Normally I check my order before leaving anywhere but they put all 4 of our boxes in the same bag so I didn't get to check the food. I got to work and one of my sides where missing so I called to let them know. They asked the people who packed the orders if they forgot my side as if they didn't believe me and didn't even apologize all they said is "oh ya you can come get it". So me and my co-worker went back to go get the side and she ran in and I stayed outside with the car running. She said the lady in the front was extremely rude and rolled her eyes. She did not even offer to help or say sorry. I will not be back especially for a $15.00 meal that comes with an attitude.

Q6WDqGzbEKzJymK5wW88jw.text: It is True that service can be slow and some orders get mixed up, especially during the lunch hour rush BUT THE FOOD IS REALLY GOOD!  Well worth the wait. If you're in the mood for some good fried chicken or fried catfish this is the place to go. The place is a bit old so don't expect a shiny new place but it definitely has character!

CkUXsSxdQXA1bwxOwrnwqw.text: I was very disappointed with the service as well as the food today. I have been a couple of times before and I have never had a complaint about the place. But today the service was pitiful. I am hoping that it was just an off day and not the way things are going to be in the future. I will give it one more chance just cause I have had such good food in the past.

Ou0OB7iI5KFUpGefPDC4fw.text: I just ate here. OMG! The food was delicious. I had the juicy chicken fried steak, Mac and cheese,cabbage and a piece of corn bread. I almost finished everything. I would recommend this place to everyone. The service was really friendly too. Thank you for a wonderful meal. I will be back..

Bwj6a22L9r8FxESm4gkrsg.text: Went here for a late lunch before the Diamondbacks game.  Despite it being close to 2:00 PM, it was pretty busy. The waitstaff was very friendly, but overall I found them to be quite slow and inattentive.  We were waiting for what seemed like an eternity when one of the waitresses (not the one who took our order) quipped "Are y'all movin' in or what?".  She immediately went to check on our order and brought it out a couple of minutes later. I had the fried chicken with macaroni and cheese and green beans as the sides. My companion had chicken fried steak with mac/cheese and black eyed peas.  We both agreed the food was OUTSTANDING.  Kick up the service a couple notches and I will gladly give this place 5 stars.

ZQw8JSUZ1hr9MfZToniRpw.text: Went here for my lunch hour, catfish was the bomb! Better than momma made it! Lol service was quick and friendly, will be returning soon!

n2_KPyFjt-0fhbT2Q8SPzg.text: The food was great! The seasoning on the chicken was superb. The fried okra is good and the Mac n cheese is very rich and creamy. The chicken is good both smothered and classic.

zrsasbh5GuDVli9_uLrtlw.text: Food took forever. Came out bland, and tasteless. Mac and cheese was mush. Yams were mush. Ordered smothered pork chops, received one pork, one beef. I didn't get sick from any cross contamination, but I didn't eat the beef chop. They were two completely different colors, but they insisted it was pork.$16 and all I ate was a pork chop, two bites of each side. None of the burnt cornbread.. and two glasses of koolaid.

W03VpLBGEE5fb0peu8odig.text: Read about Mrs. White's online and figured I should give it a try. I wish I had found it sooner. I had the chicken fried steak with rice and Mac and cheese. The portions are generous and the food is tasty. Sadly I didn't save room for dessert, but the peach cobbler looked very tempting.  I will try to remember this when I go back next time.

uUv3BZhlpbOZVbbJVKRuWA.text: Went back today and took out another 10 vehicles as I rammed into the left lane to make the turn into the lot... I meant to try pork chops, or catfish...nope, I couldn't get past the chicken. Once again, this chicken did not disappoint.  I had an annoying end to this long work day when I got home with this chicken.  But as soon as I picked up the drumstick and took a bite, it ALL washed away...seriously. Let's back up.   When I opened my styrofoam container, I noticed that the chicken had gotten slightly moist from the being closed up for almost an hour after I got it.  I thought the experience was going to be lessened.  No.   The drumstick was a bit soggy on the bottom from sitting so long, but like I said, I bit into it and all the annoyances of life went elsewhere and bothered some other guy. Perfection. Even when soggy. Even when sitting for over an hour. If fried chicken remains absolutely delicious even after all that, you know you've got some special stuff. What gets me is that I saw some young folks in the kitchen, I don't know if either of them fried the chicken, but if so - someone has been teaching them the real deal.  This tastes like some old woman who has been through years of hurt and pain but also joy and love has cooked this.  Someone who KNEW what bad chicken was and KNEW how to avoid that at all costs.  Someone who cared what their food tastes like.  And if youngens' are producing this kind of fare, that deserves proper kudos. I notice there is not a 'professional' atmosphere here.  Like another reviewer said, anything seems to go.   Honestly?  So what. The food is too friggin good.  Yes, we are entitled to good customer service as customers.  But like I said before, you get what you put in with the people here.  You come in with an attitude, that is what you get. I know some people put a high high value on customer service and how staff presents themselves; I do, too.  But chicken THIS good, and I mean specifically THIS chicken that is THIS good...I can accept the very casual atmosphere here. Yes, I wish they would put a bit more pride in their professionalism.   But I promise you, this chicken will make lovers of fried chicken not give a flying flea's fanny about anything else.  In each experience I've had with it, the chicken is THAT good.

G95BKmskGla7Uq3tD4W9BA.text: This place is as advertised. Comfort food at its best and well done. The menu is limited and the pricing is simple. I like the chicken fried steak. The cornbread is served hot. The greens are simple, just put some salt and butter on them. The ambiance? I always sit at the table with the picture of Reverend Al Sharpton

e1QGM70SJvT9kk3ZjW7H_Q.text: Okay, I was born in southern Indiana and my best fried chicken originates with the aunts, grandmothers and mom who knew how to cook fried chicken!  This chicken reminded me of some of the best I have ever tasted.  The porkchop was VERY good also (I had the combo meal) and my cornbread, redbeans and rice, and the sweet potatoes were all quite good.  Service was polite, quick and attentive.  The sweet tea was refilled several times and on time, and overall I enjoyed the meal.  In read with interest some of the recent 'poor' reviews and have to assume that they just have good days and bad days...hard to say, but I was definitely here on a good day.  I hope you experience is like mine and if it's not...sorry, but they CAN do great chicken!!

1XvQNsY0lZwQI33DZJyovA.text: Where to start?   Let's start by addressing the False advertising on their website.  After hearing a few people talk about how good the food is there , we wanted to give it a try.  We viewed their website and if you look under Entrees, you will see the meals are all priced at $10.18 per plate.  Good deal!   We arrive at the place and our first impressions are, the place needs cleaning and a paint job.  Most anyone can look past how a place looks if the service is great and the food is really good.  Most dive places I've been to have both... so the decor isn't something I get hung up on.   Service...  marginal at best.  Some guy... guessing the owner... arguing with the staff, singing... just doing whatever.  I guess this is acceptable since he owns/runs the place?  Not the best thing to do in front of customers. (again... it's a dive... not expecting 5 star services)  Server---  stops my wife in front of the bathroom door to ask if she knows what she wants to order.  Maybe wait until we are all seated and ready to order?  Thought this was pretty strange!   Now the food comes out.  Chicken wasn't horrible, wasn't great.  The canned mac-n-cheese... right up there with the best High School cafeteria mac-n-cheese.... not good!  Right from a box or can... no flavor... not homemade.   Very disappointing to say the least.  The greens... again... from a can... maybe some additional seasoning added... but.. odds are... if they were too lazy to make real mac-n-cheese... then they were too lazy to make real greens.  Gravy on the chicken... same sad story... from a box/can.... just not good or great.   Dessert--- sweet potato pie   not bad... probably one of the better things ordered.  What was crazy... if you can imaging this... take a normal/decent size slice of pie... now cut that in half and this was the serving size we got.  All for $4.99 a slice. NUTS!  $10 for two slivers of pie. A joke!   Remember I mentioned the FALSE ADVERTISING at the beginning of this review.  All meals $10.18.  NOT TRUE!  The site hasn't been updated in who knows how long?   You sit down and the menu does not show the pricing... only mention of pricing is the Ox tales for $15.00.  So... you would assume from the website the meals are $10.18 each.  WRONG....  for  two meals, two very sad/small slices of pie.... $41.00   No breakdown of the pricing ... the owner/manager just punched up some numbers on the calculator and that was the bill.   All in all... this place needs new management... some passion put back in to  the kitchen... and they need to update/clean the place.  Not to mention... in this day and age... no excuses to not having an updated website.... to properly reflect your business and pricing.  I have a feeling when Mrs White was running this place... it was awesome... not anymore.   Bad experience.. not even close to being worth the money spent. Avoid this place...save your money....  Will not be going back... will not recommend this place to anyone I know.

jyWCu-qB8EoSYk2IC35ADQ.text: Stopped by on a Saturday, pleasant atmosphere not much in the way of art but signatures of those that had been at the place. Ordered the chicken, with black eye peas, mustard mixed greens and fried okra. It was great, food was really hot and the server was good. The server Carlos came around often asking about drink refills, I even inquired about the Oxtails which I have never had, they brought out a sample and it was really good.I'm not sure why there are numerous 1 or 2 stars but I thought the food was good. The building has been around for a long time and not modern but it doesn't matter when the food is this good. At least my opinion!

6DfEg0ZfS-lkIQEHeK9Jxg.text: My first soul food experience and I'm hooked! Had the smothered fried chicken, black eyed peas, mixed greens, and fried okra. Everything was fantastic and I was most surprised by the greens. Super tasty. We'll be back again the next time were downtown.

BGS9V1sReOOIPOhSJ3DQrg.text: Tried their 3pc fried chicken with colliard greens and green beans with potatoes.  Wife had the same but with mac and cheese.  In a word, "fantastic".  Reasonable prices, too.  Wish they had white bread as neither of us can stand corn bread.  This place is a winner.

hsQR94N4Pn8eFTCPxENLJA.text: We drove all the way from north Scottsdale to try the legendary peach cobbler and voted best in the southwest southern comfort food. Server was a nice man who immediately greeted us and got our drink order. Wail waiting for our order to be taken we looked around the restaurant and noticed countless awards and magazine articles about the wonderful southern comfort food and we thought we had gone to the right place. Sadly all three of us received meals that made our tummies turn. Poor Mrs white would turn in her gave if she new what had happened to her souther food dream.The chicken sandwich is two pieces of small wings that is over breaded, dry, greasy, mostly bone fried chicken put on some dry bread with a side of your choice. Who put chicken wings on stale bread and calls it a sandwich? And the fresh caught catfish is a breaded and deep-fried disaster. The Mac and cheese was okay but could have been microwaved longer and the sweet potato were tasty but very sweet. However the black eye peas were a gummy mess and the cornbread was very disappointing and covered in grease. Not to mention wail eating the employees were cleaning around us, sweeping dust up, cleaning with dirty mop water, and washing their hands in the sanitizer water gross. However we decided to still stay and try out the peach cobbler that was award winning. Hahaha it was the worst soupy mess we had had. The dough tasted like undercooked frozen dumpling that was then covered in can peach soup and heated in the microwave. After all that the total came out to 50 bucks and 10 to the server not a meal worth 10. This place might have been good at some time but the reviews are very outdated. It is sad to say that the Kool aid was the best part of the meal.

HttQhVmJmF439CaaUNTEwA.text: Sorry, I see some "rave" reviews but this place was not even up to "Dive" standard for me.  I had been by this place, read reviews, was so excited to try it and finally got a chance to go in and eat...so excited...and then, SO DISAPPOINTED! Went there during a Diamond Back's game, no one in there except one gentleman sitting at the barstool waiting for his order.  Got in there around 1:12 p.m., and we didn't get our food until 2:20. So wanted to leave but we felt uncomfortable leaving when we had already ordered, I had waited so long to try it and we were the only one's in there for the last half hour...awkward.  We could not believe it took over an hour to get our food, AGAIN, we were the only one's in there for over a half hour! We ordered the chicken and it came with two sides and a piece of cornbread. The cornbread was so dry my 9 year old niece almost choked trying to force done a small bite.  I didn't believe her so I tried, it was so dry I put it down without finishing; note to restaurant, YOU CANNOT microwave corn bread back to life!  I will say this, I did finish it only because I was waiting over an an hour for food...it became a "eat in hunger desperation" thing.    Once the food finally came, and AGAIN, still the only customers (that should have been my tipoff...UGH), it was not impressive.  The chicken was nothing special, nothing.  I make better at home.  The side of Mac n'Cheese was good and thank goodness something was good...not great, just good.  I had the green beans, again nothing worth remarking that another restaurant could not do.  I don't know if it was just because I was so hungry or whatever, I ate all my green beans and Mac.  Nothing spectacular, and nothing I will ever go back for.    Service was horrible, they were not even ashamed of the crap service, didn't even bother to give us another piece of dry-arsed corn bread and only checked on us once.  I went, I ate and was NOT impressed.    Go, judge for yourself.  Sadly, I know you will probably be disappointed.  You will have an appreciation for the expression "Meh."  They are over-priced and over hyped.  Glad I got it out of my system.  I could give them more than 1 star but that would be dishonest.

1SIJ-8BNOzPt_C6OoyL8lA.text: Nothing friendly about  the staff to start. I came here ordered Togo, food took forever. I guess  I should've  checked  it before  I got home  because  there was half a spoon full of each side. But I should've  known  better  considering  the dirty looks from the counter person when walked in. Funny thing is a semi famous  celebrity  comes in and gets his food in five mins flat.  Had the waiter actually  done his job he would've gotten  a good tip but I left him $2 anyway as he was more helpful  then the asshole old man at the counter.  Never again

HS64qefL6er5G06qa_-_XQ.text: Stopped in for lunch and had the chicken fried steak (about the size of my head), cabbage, and red beans -  add a drink and it was still well under $20. Food was hot and flavorful and seasoned just right. A little bit  rough setting but more than made up for it with the food and ultimately that's what you're there for right?   Staff seemed a little overwhelmed and probably could have used one more person.   Definitely will be back!

1KgLHltMWD99aGukqa25MA.text: Okay, so I am rather new to town and have been to very famous and not so famous soul food restaurants around the world, and this one is to me, only decent.  I decided to try this restaurant out today after visiting an historical church for Sunday service, that is right across the street.    As I walked over to the restaurant, I got giddy inside thinking that I would be welcomed by absolutely amazing down home soul food that I have experienced in Harlem, Houston, St. Louis, New Jersey, and even Philly, but I was not.  I knew that the ambiance was not going to be upscale, which is fine with me, but the food is not as exciting as the previous reviewers make it seem.  Maybe my taste buds are a little too snobby, but like I said I have had amazing soul food in other places, not just the South.   Moving on, I had the fried chicken, mac n cheese, black eyed peas, cabbage, and corn bread.  I must say that the black eyed peas and corn bread were pretty good, but the cabbage lacked lots of flavor, and so did the fried chicken.  Also the fried chicken was very salty, but lacked flavor, which to me is a little oxymoronic.   The waitress/waiter were very nice.  I will not go back because I do not feel like the meal was worth the $13.00 plus tax.  I will go over and try Lo-Los Chicken and Waffles soon and hopefully there, I will find delicious soul food that I left behind on the East Coast in New Jersey, NY, and Philly!

_Yl1hKjV6VQf9VL3hcEcyw.text: Yes they are family but Mrs White's is BETTER than LoLos!!! Bigger portions and less $$ not to mention less wait time and better parking. $13 gets you a 3 piece meal with two large sides and cornbread. Mac n cheese and greens are THE best sides. Drink water instead of Koolaid or Tea and save the sugar for dessert with her famous Peach Cobbler with a scoop of vanilla ice cream! Oh my I am salivating ;)

yG3SoZNpb1weXjhE-qIEeQ.text: Um, yeah. Very yeah. Mrs. White's may be a dive but what a dive it is! The fried chicken and smothered pork chops are so ridiculously good that it's hard to imagine visiting Phoenix again and not heading back there the moment I land at the airport. I would give it 5 stars but the atmosphere is...um...an acquired taste.

Vd1oquU8xaj0xnTzI7Z3TA.text: Amazing. This is one of those, "Don't judge a book by it's cover".  The outside may not look like much. But you get that scrumptious food in your mouth and down in your belly, you won't be sorry.  I had the Southern Fried Chicken. WOW! It was so tender & juicy with a crispy authentic batter. Also had the yams that made me want more & more. This is a MUST. Try it and you'll be craving it again and again.

1OwYoT8b93hPH-v729NJxw.text: This is a tough one.  I'd found out about Mrs. White's by way of Lo-Lo's, and thought I'd try Mama's food before Son's.  It was good, I'll say that.  I had the smothered chicken and regretted it immensely - fried chicken covered with gravy amounts to a mess of watery breading.  Between that and having to dig through the mess to find the bones, it wasn't exactly a lot of meat down my throat.  Mac & Cheese and white rice as my sides were good.  The ambiance?  There IS none.  I found more entertainment from the writing on the wall, which had clearly been painted over MANY times since the 60s, and the open/close sign which reads, if closed, to contact "Jesus".  LOL.  Unaware of the church across the street, I arrived right after Sunday services to find the place fairly full - some churchgoers, at least one newcomer party, and several regulars.  Based on the caloric content of the entrees, I wasn't surprised to see about 50% obese customers, while the rest were inexplicably thin.  As a Whitey, I can't say that I was comfortable.  Clientele is almost all Black and while they are some of my best friends, I only felt welcome because of the cordial words spoken by our waiter and the cashier at the checkout, who clearly could have beat the crap out of me with one punch.  Other than that, there were a lot of "what are YOU doing here?" looks from fellow customers.  I kept wishing I had brought my sista friend with me, who would have loved this place.  I'd go back, but it's not a perfect choice.  Perhaps on a Saturday when church hadn't just let out.  Also, the price is extreme - it's almost as high as Knott's Berry Farm which gives you more food for only about $2 more, and that's at theme park prices.  This is just dumpy outskirts of downtown..but again, I don't wanna judge.  I love small business and I'm proud of Mrs. White for making it this long; hope she continues for a long time to come.

uwCp9JbWNt_2Hb9Tv_39AQ.text: Go there for the food, not the ambiance.  I am an expert on Chinese restaurants so no problem for me!  Four drunk conventioneers decided on a Wednesday night in August to do Soul Food.  Two starched white guys both formerly from Texas made the suggestion.  One black dude formerly from South Carolina, and me a Hong Kong Chinese who grew up in Detroit.  Quite a foursome.  We stumbled into this place near downtown while the sun was still up.  Very spartan diner with counter and a few tables.  Sharpie autographs on the wall from the famous to the not so much.  It was near closing time because we ordered and ended up being the only ones in the place when food arrived in a trickle.  I had the fry chicken with collar greens and mac cheese sides.  Wonderfully crunchy and moist inside chicken.  Sides were perfect just like my childhood friend's Mom use to make.  My buds went for the steak fried chicken and two had the fried pork chops.  I only need to say that all plates where cleaned out.  No booze.  The ice tea had me worried, but I was told its made from Phoenix's famous tap water which is full of minerals.  The was the only downside.  Don't know but if they are okay with BYOB, If so, I will return someday from San Francisco.  Recommend this place if you need a soul food fix near downtown.  Close early around 8 pm.

0venFm-js31xZsaS53AiHg.text: Very friendly and fast service.  We were greeted with a smile and good ole southern hospitality.  From reading some of the negative reviews, it seems like those reviewers aren't too familiar with soul food. In a soul food restaurant "sandwich" is open faced with no garnish.  Condiments available by requests.  And chicken will always be served with bones.  LOL. The fried pork chop sandwich and 1 side is just enough for a mid day lunch.

tEdcZMBPq_KSoc5QTWa6eA.text: Great soul food. Pork shops smothered in gravy were awesome. Fried okra, Mac and cheese, and cornbread were fantastic as well.

owsU14mCyOCjY220UVqBYg.text: My dad first showed me this restaurant when I was around 10. 20 years later and I am still in love with their catfish. Today I had the chicken for the first time in a few years. Still delicious, but it wasn't as flavorful. However, the blackeyed peas and cabbage haven't changed. This makes me happy since they are my staple sides. The only reason I can't give a five star is the last two times I have been, it hasn't been the same quality that I once found to be so consistent. However, the service has been just as warm and friendly since I first walked into this unique Phoenix establishment.

KkyJbzl9s0Oxqcj2tmjpHg.text: When you go to Mrs. White's you will get down home food. You will also get down home service, which means prepare to be ignored while the staff talks and laugh among themselves.  The food was good but the only problem is if you go two hours before closing time they will be out of most (if not all) of the side dishes and desserts, which is very odd. You rarely find it crowded (except maybe on Sundays after church) so it seems as if they would rather have less sides or just enough than too much. I can't imagine a restaurant constantly "running out of food" all the time.  It took us about 45 minutes to get our food and only after the waitress told us every 15 minutes they had no more mac and cheese, then no more sweet potatoes, then no more greens.   The chicken was very good and so was the cornbread, but I've been here several times and the service is the same.  As we were looking to pay our bill the owner (or someone related to Mrs. White I assume) was on the phone talking to someone about going out that night, over charged us, swore we owed more than we did (all the while he's still having a conversation on the phone) and when we finally told him he over charged us he just said "oh".  The food isn't enough to make up for the service and vanishing dessert and sides options, so I think I won't be going back.

6gqxPx4__fsnZfCPl_jaQQ.text: If this review was only for the food i would give it a higher score. Over priced but very good. Waiter seemed a little overworked but he did a fine job. However, when we went to pay we were stuck standing there for about 10 minutes until an older gentleman finally came out and barely said a word to me. He pulled the receipt and tossed it at me without saying a word. I signed it only to make sure the waiter got his tip and the man tossed my copy at me the same way. The man was incredibly rude and i will never ever return. Ill stick with lolo's.

4GDPrc-K3tmaR0e6C6v92Q.text: Such wonderful humans and delicious food. We ordered the fried okra, macaroni and cheese, black eyed peas, and green beans as our sides and had the golden fried southern chicken (regular and smothered) for our main. All of it was cooked to perfection and fed our souls. Their fried chicken beats Lolo's any day and rivals Roscoe's in LA.

SyYyYJwp7Vlu1tdqwKyquw.text: Been wanting to try Mrs. Whites for some time with all the great reviews. Very friendly folks with super service was a plus but sadly the food was just ok and not worth the price. I ordered the Chicken Fried Steak which was tender and had a nice light coating of Gravy. It was good but not great and lacked a little flavoring or at least some salt. For sides I opted for the green beans with red potato and the Mac and Cheese. The Green Beans were directly from a can with the same juice with a crushed red potato, again no flavor or spice, really? The Mac and Cheese was a huge disappointment having had better at a Walmart Deli. I wish my phon battery was not dead as the tiny slice of stale cornbread made me chuckle, exactly 1 inch by 1.5 inch. :)  $15.86 for a lackluster meal is not what I was expecting nor would I go out of my way to go back, even to see the happy waitress.

v2gYqtcVzCzQUkpu_gRK6Q.text: This place sucks ass! For one the staff is rude! Completely rude! They act as though it's an inconvenience to be serving you. As if since their food is good they can treat you any kind of way. Hospitality will not be found. Second their food is not all its made out to be. Sorry I'll never give this place my money again. I've found me a awesome spot somewhere else in the east valley.

m1ZRInFvt2MNNDX_C3btnA.text: This chicken was awesome. It was pretty darn delicious. HOWEVER, the inside of the chicken, how disappointing... It taste like the chicken hadn't really had time to marinade? The skin was seasoned perfectly and crispy so I made sure to get a bite of that in with every piece of meat.  The mac-n-cheese, mushy and not very tasty. The potato salad, yums!! Very good on that mix. And the corn bread, how disappointing. It was dry and tasteless. I was really looking forward to it too because corn bread and soul food, hand in hand right?? Not so much here :-\  I wanted to try Lolo's up the street but I think they were closed for construction or something. For some reason I have a feeling that place would be more of what I was looking for.

L4IFFFjVD9-jmAAcreCFbg.text: Hands Down best Chicken House ever  not fancy not fast food but a great place to chill and enjoy down home chicken

y4Ovz8idMWB02t-HEUFWzw.text: The best breaded catfish ever, collard greens were on point  and the corn bread was real corn bread. Fried chicken was a little to over fried for my taste but the chicken itself was great
