4UH6Y8dqNu0vPT9MoYr-sw.text: Food: 5/5 I ordered the chicken fried steak. It was delicious, enough said.   Service: 2/5 One person got their food within 15 minutes, the next couple got it 10 minutes later, and we finally got all of our food after an hour had passed. They are very slow at cooking.   Atmosphere: 2/5  It's kinda cool seeing the signatures.... but it's not great looking in there; kinda divey.  Waitress: 5/5 Doris was amazing.   Value: 3/5  A little pricey but not too outrageous.   Overall I would say 4/5, definitely worth a visit for the food.

78PK5XPw1-hr7yod1rY99A.text: In the famous words of Flavor Flav "Dont believe the hype"! Being from Cleveland, Ohio Iv been looking forward to trying the food here for years just never got around to it. Well today was the day. Not that busy even for a Sunday. We sat down and waited for about 13 minutes before anyone ever came over, the cook from the kitchen had to come out and give us our menus. We ordered it came out in a reasonable time except for my chicken I ordered, that came out just as I was almost finished with my meal. Yes I ordered everything together with my initial order. We had to wait for silverware. Our drinks didn't get refilled until we were about finished. We was offered cornbread as we was about finished eating which was not good at all! Mac n cheese tasted just like stouffers. Greens were bland. Yams were good. The fish was ok. Chicken was over fried and bland. The koolaid was really good. I dont think I'll be making the drive from Surprise to visit again.

photos.caption: Photo of Mrs White's Golden Rule Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States

Yt3bfdilhWAKCBzOtw6rvA.text: I've been to mrs. White's at least four or five times. I don't get to go as often as I used to wish I could but after my last trip I will never go back. Racism has been something that's in Arizona I have never had to experience until my last trip. . Because of my skin color I believe they treated me differently.I went with my kids and my wife who are half and full Hispanic I am white. Not only were everybody else in my table served the two tables that came in after us were served before them and it wasn't until pointed out that they had not brought me my food yet I finally received half of my order. When we went to pay we had to stand by the front counter for someone to come to us timed for 8 minutes. and when she came out she asked if we were looking for a check then walked by us to continue to talk to other people's she seems happier to have at her establishment. Racism is wrong and while it felt that was the motivation maybe they will chalk it up to a bad day but it felt personal. Because of their actions I'll never go back and I hope others will be aware

gE9HoMucDOWdmLXhrP9FAw.text: I'm kinda in love w/Mrs. White's... ok...where to start...first, I really, really love the servers/cooks/owners, always happy to see you, treat you like you're in their kitchen which I love. This is not a Scottsdale, white napkin, fine dining place, it's Mrs. White's, if that's what you're expecting (it's soul food) move on down the road, you'll just annoy the rest of us. Sooo... the food.... BEST GREENS EVER, if they'd sell me a bathtub full I'd be a happy, happy girl, but alas, best I can do is 3 sides. Chicken fried steak, fried chicken, Mac and Cheese, . The smothered pork chops and ox tails are superb, come early for the ox tails, they go fast.  The cobbler is delish, and sweet potato pie (special) are the best, but get them to go for later because you'll be too stuffed to enjoy them after your meal.  The guests are always the best, it's a small place, but a social fun atmosphere if you're not a tool....just be nice, and you'll get nice, just like the rest of the world...easy peasy....DELICIOUS, go, you'll love it, just wear your jeans or shorts, it's that kind of place, and we like it that way....

44nLHO8MchzSJRIlWKD-lA.text: Great southern fried chicken!  Simple menu with standard options. I ordered the regular chicken plate with black eyed peas and mac n cheese.   Can't wish to go again!

photos.caption: Photo of Mrs White's Golden Rule Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken, black eyed peas, and the mac n cheese.

jjyko9FRMotKvLw9PPqLDg.text: We wouldn't have Lolo's if it wasn't for Mrs. White. This food is amazing and a Phoenix institution. Great chicken and feels like momma made it. But you know your momma can't cook so go here! Lol. Sides like homemade and dessert that you catch the itis from.

8ESeTsyrpgijDcqE3SvSWQ.text: I got the fried chicken, Mac and Cheese and Black eyed peas. It took forever but was worth the wait. Oml hands down best fried chicken in Phoenix

GHVnm0_dbEE6izqY3dLljw.text: Mrs. Whites has gone down ! I got the smothered pork chop and fried chicken- was suppose to 2 pieces of fried chicken. They gave me one big fried dry nasty chicken breast. The pork chop was not smothered - it was fried and gravy dumped on it. It to was dry and the blackeyed peas were bland - no flavor and same with the rice and gravy. The cornbread was good and so was the kool-aid ! And customer service is poor. No one really cared about the food and made me pay for my drink. And we went in the about 11:30 am . The bathrooms had not been cleaned- they were nasty and only one roll of toilet paper. It will be last visit. I tried about month ago and thought would give it another try. Still bad experience.

4wcmSkgTwV4pCL6PsqCSCA.text: If I could add more stars I would!I remember coming here as a teen and still the same amazing food I remembered.I definitely recommend this placeAlso the staff is very attentive and thoughtful.Love this place and glad My Mom made the decision to go yesterday and refresh our taste buds memory.

7lqmQ07vXUkPRZI476AJcw.text: This place was a staple in the community. Food use to be on point and delicious. Now the service takes 20 minutes cause a lady is talking and taking her time. We waited for our food for over 30 minutes and it was over fried. Come to find out they only have 1 deep fryer and use that for everyone's order. Empty tables with dirty dishes on it. Won't be back until they can turn this hot mess around.

photos.caption: Photo of Mrs White's Golden Rule Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States

Q2bQCQIVyjE1ujL8gH7NIA.text: Went for my first one and not off to a good start. Waited 39 min to have my order taken then waited another 15 minutes to be told they have NO chicken. Left completely disappointed. I've waited years of hearing how good the food is only to finally make it and be told they are out of chicken a 1:30 pm on a Sunday afternoon! Not a great start.

L-iBeZHMP2XLXkuGQQP3Sg.text: This place is a dump . It's dirty , and the staff were nasty . I felt very uncomfortable there . You could cut the atmosphere with a knife . So much tension . The food was horrible . I was only there once , and I never went back . Save your money , Go somewhere else .

_7fuHdvPcCiDqfUpmSY0iw.text: I expect pretty much the same thing every time I go to Mrs White's. It's either the food or the service that's not very good. We were greeted promptly enough there were only two other patrons in the restaurant was there about 5 on a Wednesday afternoon. I asked the server if they were out of anything before I ordered, she said no. I then proceeded to ask what kind of pie they had and was told they were out. We were served a plate of two pieces of cornbread and then proceeded to order our meal. I ordered chicken fried steak with black eyed peas and fried okra my friend ordered Fried Chick'n, black-eyed peas and potato salad. We also ordered two ice tea's one regular and one sweetened. It sounds good so far doesn't it.?  Here's where things started to go wrong, the corn bread was tough and chewy and struck me as something that was put in the microwave. Both Iced Teas had somewhat of a "woody" taste which told me it was either old tea or the teapot needed to be cleaned. When I was served my meal, the waitress told me that the okra looked the way it did because somebody had left the freezer door open, my okra was served in 3 smash down lumps. While I was eating my dinner which I should say the chicken fried steak and they Black Eyed Peas were pretty good. Another waitress came over and leaned next to me and asked if she could taste my okra, yes she asked for a bite of my food. I proceeded then to pick up one of the clumps of okra and give it to her which she ate and walked away. (Who does that). My friends meal was pretty good but the Fried Chicken was a little dry and tough. The same waitress also told us a little bit of history about the restaurant which was nice but then also what the restaurant purchases as opposed to making homemade.  I have been to Mrs White's on numerous occasions, and found it to be pretty much hit-or-miss so I'm not disappointed when I go. No expectations.

27Hb7OJgidOSDZFGc3Tmaw.text: Placed an order to take out. 7 piece fried chicken, they gave me 1 wing, 2 thighs, and 2 breasts that they cut in half to make up the 7 pieces.  Wouldn't  be half as bad if they didn't charge me $2.50 per piece.  Basically I paid $17.50 for 5 pieces of chicken.  1st and last time I will ever go there.

swx0LiYBC64wv_BWyjUq-Q.text: I have to say that typically I love this place but my daughter and I came in tonight for dinner and waited well over an hour for our food.  There were only 3 tables with people when we got there but several that came in after us got served first.  They were apologetic as they had someone walk out but they were very vocal about the issue.  It would have been enough to go through that but rather than pushing through, at one point 4 of the staff were out chatting with customers at the counter while several of us still didn't have our meals.  What we got tasted great but it certainly feels like they have gotten too comfortable with their reputation and I wonder if that is coming out in their lack of customer service.  I was very disappointed, it will be awhile before I go back or recommend Mrs. Whites.  Very sad.

yEijZRGM4z0MjAl-aBtpxQ.text: I really wanted to like this place but when I pay for a $13 Fried chicken dish I expect at least a piece of Breast not three drum sticks. When our children ordered we were told that they ran out of Mac n Cheese no problem we can change the side dishes but as we waited and everyone that came after us who were obviously friends were being served and got two breast and mac n cheese we realize that we didn't make the cut as customers that mattered. To top it off I asked for my sweet tea about 5 times, twice I had to get up and ask for it and I got nothing.  The food was good but maybe have real waitresses not kids tending to customers, treat all customers like you treat those who are you friends it was not fair that we were enthusiastically looking forward to eating at Mrs White with our kids but really got a bad experience in customer service.

WclbinQ-m1BzZhfNfTJXHw.text: I would've given it a 5 if it was just based off the food. The food was delicious, no complaints about the food at all. The service was HORRIBLE, absolutely horrible. We waited about 15 minutes to even get acknowledged. They gave one of us tea instead of lemonade and waited about 10-15 minutes for them to bring us the lemonade. One of the people in my group only ordered Mac and Cheese. We all received our food but they didn't bring her Mac and cheese. We waited another 15 minutes and asked three different people for the Mac and cheese before receiving it. Also, two of the guests had a side of red beans that was not brought out with their meal. We asked all three employees at least 2-3 times for their red beans and rice. Finally one order was brought out but not the other. So then we had to wait even longer for the second order to come out. This was after asking another 2-3 times about the red beans.   If I ever eat here again, I'll see about calling ahead and ordering for takeout. Like I said, the food was delicious.. I ordered the vegetable plate and it was amazing. The service just made this a miserable experience though.

photos.caption: Photo of Mrs White's Golden Rule Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States

-zmNURFU1i0Ym6inFiTwEg.text: This is easily the best southern-style food in all of Phoenix. I've been here close to 10 times now and there is absolutely no doubt that it's the best.   I've gotten the chicken fried steak, smothered chicken, pork chops, and catfish before and you absolutely cannot go wrong with any decision.   With that said, you are coming here for the food, not the venue or the service. The venue is clearly old school, but I think they've avoided changing anything to keep in touch with their historical roots in Phoenix. To my knowledge, this place has been here for decades.   The service can be a hit or miss. There is a chance you will end up with a server that you'll never see again after you get your food so if you want to get something else or just get your refill you'll be out of luck. However, that is not a reason to not check this place out! I'd highly recommend it just based on the food alone!

9C3TuA035j5mdpWTa_pG_w.text: First time today and was very happy with the food.  Good portions, well done and we really enjoyed it.  A tad over priced, however. Everything is $13 and not sure the reflects the portions etc.  However, I will be back

25ziPB8asr6bqAC7DGKpZQ.text: This place is truly amazing! I had always heard about how good it was and finally had the opportunity to eat here the other night before attending a show at the Orpheum. I went with the Fried Chicken and had the rice-gravy and mac & cheese as my sides. With the complimentary corn bread to go with it you can't go wrong. The service was very good and I will hopefully be back in the near future!

dN5cwLjzw1-IKV2fhlNjeA.text: This place is AMAZING!  The real deal!  I was traveling in PHX and someone recommended we try this place out.  We did and went back three times that week.  I was back for a conference and I dragged a group there and they loved it too!  The fried chicken and the breaded pork chops were amazing.  I really enjoyed the mac and cheese and there is nothing like washing it down with a hugh glass of ice cold fruit punch.  I can't wait until my next trip to PHX...this will definitely be a stop!

6DgtQOGQEsmILfpp2lKmaA.text: THE best of everything, their chicken is not like any other, everything is to die for. Their tea is freshly brewed, sweetened and unsweetened, their beans and rice are amazing.  It is across from CHASE FIELD, they have autographed ceilings, floors and walls, you never know who will show up.  It closes at 1:00p.m, so, get there early.

Qd2Jayvue9neDj8qNs23IA.text: I honestly don't know how anyone can rate this restaurant more than 1 star.  We saw this restaurant featured on Check Please Arizona and being from the south, we were excited to try it.  I decided to take my husband there for his birthday.  Let me start off with the review of the food - it was terrible.  The chicken was greasy, and had no flavor.  The sides were as bad as a school cafeteria.  But the service is even worse!  We arrived around 1:30 on a Saturday.  There were 2 large tables of people and a few other tables but still lots of empty tables (the place is pretty small).  We chose a table in the back - huge mistake, because it reeked of the smells from the bathroom.  But I wanted to try to stay positive since it was my husband's birthday.  We waited only a few minutes before a waiter came by to give us menus and get our drink order.  We ordered non-sweet tea - however, we got one sweet and one non-sweet, we were able to get that remedied, but when the waiter came back to give us the tea, he wouldn't take our order even though we said we were ready.  He said he had to get a pencil and paper and would be back. Well, he didn't come back for almost 45 minutes!  That's not to say he wasn't around, when the large table's food was ready, the brought out the plates one by one - several minutes apart.  Several other tables came in during this time, while we were still waiting to order, he actually took he new tables orders before ours!  Finally, I spoke up next time he was in our vicinity and told him we still hadn't ordered.  Even after this, it took him about 10 minutes to come back!  We should have walked out, but now it was a mission to see how long it would take.  After we ordered, we waited again.  At some point, a man came out and asked a table near us, but who had came in well after us, how long they had been waiting, and this nice lady told him that our table had been waiting longer than hers.  Turns out, they got their food before we did!  In fact several tables that came in after us got food before us.  Finally, we got our food and let me say that I have had better fried chicken from KFC - I actually think they might have gotten the chicken from KFC, because I don't remember the smell of chicken frying in the restaurant.  And of course they got our sides wrong.  At the end of our meal, a lady came by again to the table near us and apologized for the delay and asked if she could provide a dessert on the house, again the nice lady customer informed the employee that in fact we had been there much longer than them, The employee then just looked at us and reluctantly came to our table and asked us if we wanted dessert.  Having lived in the south, I am familiar with racial tensions, and I have read the other Yelpers mentioning the disparity of service for non-dark customers, this place is worse than anything I have ever experienced.  Two hours waiting for a lunchtime meal!  That's CRAZY!  I felt unwelcome and unimportant to the business.  I will never go there again.  And after all of that, it was $34.00!!  Maybe they charge by the number of minutes you occupy the table?  I think I owe my husband another birthday dinner....

aH8IptmhbhVSj2eOz2eFCw.text: I have read some pretty negative and hateful comments about this place.   I personally liked this place and will return.  Coming here, you can see there is zero ambiance, but its the food that counts.  I know when I walked in the ambiance would suck.... Service wasn't the greatest.  What counts for me is the food. Portions were huge. My plate overflowed.  I ordered  fried chicken and boyfriend had catfish.  Both were extremely delicious.  Had a homemade quality and much better than fast food.  I will return and try other dishes.  Don't expect great service and don't expect the prettiest place to sit, expect good home cooked food. I think we were supposed to get corn bread but it never came either....

HhoVLTtS3LN9PmGI7nXwOg.text: I've heard such amazing things about this place that I couldn't wait to try it.  I finally did and it was okay.  The service was sub par.  Waitstaff were chewing food while serving my drink. They ran out of food and forgot our cornbread.  I liked the lively crowd.  Location is tough to get to with all the one way streets.  I probably will not go back.

FIek64_8zpeMD730a5wpnw.text: The food is good, but I just cannot get past how horrible the service was. It took us almost 2 hours to order and eat our food, what were they doing? The restaurant was not full, it was not busy. Probably will not be going back.

nc3O1OeowvoKm3lLDqsAjw.text: Convenient spot diagonal from the stadium. Great place for smothered pork chops... Greens and sweet potatoes like gma made... Check out the autographs on the wall.

OfLDkFCftwzQGMWaifbn9g.text: Just Like the South  We love your typical meat-and-three type restaurants across the South.  We never expected to find such a place in Arizona.  At Mrs White's, you would think that you were in Nashville or Birmingham.  The fried chicken was delicious and the mixed greens very nice.  I do wish that they had mashed potatoes.  Unfortunately, they had run out of their famous peach cobbler, so we'll have to go back.

G7PfAJh2cNlm95rZVHgS-Q.text: Ew.. Let's start with that. I went into mrs whites skeptical of the help reviews. I figured I would either love it or hate it. I walked in and the staff could've cared less that I was there. I was yelled at from the counter to see if I wanted anything to drink. The sweet tea is very good, I will give them that. The staffs clothing was dirty and unkept. It looked like they hadn't brushes their hair in days. We were pretty neglected and got no useful tips from ordering off of their very limited menu. The food was okay, the cornbread and canned yams being the best. It was good to go see what everyone was taking about but I will not be back again.

_twK2RcA943d0-LjtQ2Acw.text: Three words: Incredible Fried Chicken!  Just visited this place for the first time and the food is amazing.  It's only a block from Chase Field where the Diamondbacks play and they were open until 7:00 pm on the Wednesday that I visited.  I visited in the afternoon around 3:30 and it wasn't busy.  There were three or four people at the counter and one guy in a booth.  I grabbed a booth (very comfy by the way) and was served right away.    Their menu is very basic  (main dishes, side dishes & desserts).  I ordered the Fried Chicken dinner, which comes with two sides (described below).  My beverage: a lemonade.  They don't have soda at this restaurant, which was a bummer, but the lemonade is tasty - not too tart, not too sweet.  The fried chicken is the best I"ve had in town.  The meal comes with three juicy pieces of mouth-watering chicken and the flavor is the best I've had in valley.  This isn't fast food fried chicken.  This is fried chicken your mama would make.  Yummy!  One of my sides was green beans with potatoes.  I've never had this combination of vegetables together before and it was really tasty.  I think the green beans were from a can but I'm not sure about the potatoes.  Regardless, this was a nice side dish.  I put a little pepper on it and I was good to go.  My other side dish was rice with gravy.  I guess I'm new to soul food because I've never heard of this combination before either.  The rice they use is excellent.  I'm not sure what it was but it had a better flavor than Uncle Ben's rice.  Some kind of gravy is mixed with the rice and the two together gave me a whole new yummy experience.   I couldn't finish the whole meal and had to get a to-go box.  If I hadn't been so full I would have loved to try their dessert of the day, peach cobbler.    I would definitely recommend this restaurant to people.  It's really close to downtown Phoenix and the ball park and the food is made with a lot of love, just like Mom would make.

IVBu-mEi9r0OiNb4MnhW_A.text: Down Home in Phoenix! Be prepared for some culture shock and forget about your diet for the day.  Great southern cooking in a funky building... interesting atmosphere, with customer graffiti on the walls.  Worth a try for the experience!

sffV-az92bf8w47vGXE7Uw.text: Everything was sooo sooo good!!! We had ox tails, fried chicken, greens, black eyed peas, cornbread & the kool-aid was on point and we can't forget the peach cobbler. .. May God continue to bless this place!! :)

5ikfNpPcjL5Ld1JVF0larg.text: This place was AWESOME!!!  Unfortunately I've grown a bit jaded by soul food joints. Typically a cafeteria style-set up, with grouchy, attitutde-y women working the line. Even if you try to be fun, you won't be able to crack a smile.   Mrs. White's is not that.   The first soul food joint that has it all! The employees were so SO nice. Engaging in coversation, our waitress was very articulate and so cute. The bus boy was engaging, and the owner/manager, was just a hoot!   The food! Delicious, large portions! 1. Fried chicken- mmmm mmmm, big chunks, well-spiced, finger lickin good, and no skimping! 2. Sweet potatoes- sweet, sugary, good 3. Mac n cheese- pretty standard 4. Red beans and rice- this was a twist to the usual red beans and rice.  5. Corn bread- would've liked some butter or honey butter. Yum  The ambiance is killer--tagged up all over the walls! Super cool!  I hope to go back when I'm in Phx. Great service, people, and food.

Jfj0A6BZWujkGQdP8BILKg.text: I've been there twice in the last three weeks and it lives up to its reputation. The Mrs. set the standard and they are carrying it on fo' real! The Food Network was shooting on the day I went for the show "Best Food I Ever Ate." On their plate was the fried chicken, mac and cheese, and mixed greens. (I had that the first time.) Did the smothered pork chops this time and it was an experience...a food lover's experience. Certainly worth putting on you to do list. Unfortunately, many of the people who live here don't know about it and it's a historical landmark in the state.

photos.caption: Photo of Mrs White's Golden Rule Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pork chops, mac and cheese, mixed greens, corn bread, and sweet tea!
Photo of Mrs White's Golden Rule Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Where you want to be.

R3MDM91WFz3ImTuKwejB7w.text: I can only give this 1 star and that's because the gentleman who checked us in and out was so kind. The food was awful, and our waitress was so nasty. I grew up on soul food and this doesn't come close to what i was raised on. I was so looking forward to a good home cooked meal, yuk, no flavor, such a disappointment, oh and if that's cornbread, then i don't know what to say.Oh and i forgot, they were out of dessert, how does that happen, not one dessert, that's one of the reasons we went. never again.

3is7e_YKh4TLenOepGrUHQ.text: The 2 times we have gone there, they were closing.. What type of restaurant has soul food hours from 10:00-7:00? The average person gets off work at 5:00, that means you only have about a hour to get over there and eat. I will not be going back...ever.

_FG3K06fWxDPqtRKPvtDdg.text: Don't understand the hype about this place. Went in today only to be disappointed.  Nothing spectacular.

Po2WTqDQPPKnoZYdIAiqgw.text: If you want a great home cooked meal...then eat here. The place is real small but the food is great. For 10 and some odd cents you get a whole lot of food for little money.  For drinks they have  Iced tea, lemon-aid, coffee, kool-aid, water. The outside and inside do not look like much, but it's the food that is great. Try it, you'll go back!

qgZEAiPYBMx1V3TUc2IJ8g.text: The staff is sloven and lazy. I waited 15-20 minutes to check out. The wall is covered in magic marker graffiti. The food was blah. If I was a homeless man starving and someone offered me dinner here I would refuse. Dirty floor. And bland food. They must be a place where people go once WHILE ATTENDING A DBacks game . Never again. NEVER. At most I would order a coconut and a hammer, provided they touched neither. Soulless food served slowly. Oh and the tea was rancid. From a couple days earlier. Nastiness reigned.

P0QdgA_h322qwPxVGSDSSQ.text: This has got to be my worst experience in any type of restaurant or cafe ive ever been to... i brought my family today at 1230pm and decided to leave at 3:10pm because we didnt get served and we saw atleaast 4 families get served and we had got there before them. We waited 2 and a half hours to not get serviced and wasted our whole sunday afternoon in this establishment...im not the one who usually complains but this was fucking ridiculous and felt i had to complain to what we experienced today.

DqJo5WdjcuI3VPXSqf3QXA.text: The food was okay, but the restaurant was very unclean,please do not go into the restroom you will lose your lunch. The Waitress was less than enthusiastic about customer service. Not to mention the prices are ridiculous for the scene and the food. Save time and money go somewhere else.

photos.caption: Photo of Mrs White's Golden Rule Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fried catfish, mac and cheese, and black-eyed peas.
Photo of Mrs White's Golden Rule Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fried okra

iw1-K25HfykW6YIDRWUvxQ.text: The food is excellent! It reminds me of my grandmother's, aunts', and mother's home cooking. The customer service while we were in the restaurant was pretty good. The reason I cannot give them a five star review is because of something that happened immediately after we left the restaurant. One of the students we were dining with left their to-go container of food in the restaurant on accident. Our server brought it out to us and said, "Do y'all want this sh**?" That's not how you should speak to any customer, let alone a group that has children with them. My experience was dramatically soured by this. The other employees even recognized the inappropriateness of the statement because she asked him, "Why you say it like that?" Although I really liked the food, I don't think I can return because that sends the message that it's alright to speak to customers in this manner, and it is not.

SwG0YZSER5T03SU48WlXgg.text: Before I moved downtown I had never heard of this place. Chicken... Seriously. I really don't need to talk about any of the other items on the menu but everything I have eaten has been amazing. But the chicken is unlike any other fried chicken i have ever had. It is crispy on the outside and juicy on the inside. The badder they use is fried to perfection and expertly seasoned. This small yellow building could pass you if you are not looking for it but please trust me when I say, you will regret not eating here.

Y36OUFs-MlwhgaGA_UUOmw.text: Interesting concept of customer service. No refills, didn't ask if we needed anything, didn't even ask how our meal was. Couldn't get the orders correct. Potato salad has to be store bought, tastes like Resers. The cabbage and greens were bland. Disappointing because they have a decent reputation.,

OztzZE36defeMRBj9nE4pA.text: This is the first five star rating I've given on Yelp.  I have never had anything there that I didn't absolutely love.  Do not be fooled by cheap imitations (Lolo's...oh please!); nothing compares to Mrs. White's.    Main courses:  their chicken fried steak is the best I've had and the smothered pork chops are excellent as well....extremely moist and flavorful.    Side dishes:  I am a fool for their mac and cheese.  Mac and cheese is probably my all time favorite food and Mrs. White's is the best I have ever put in my mouth.  I also love the fact that they serve rice and gravy as a side dish.  The green beans are delicious (I rarely say that about a vegetable).  The greens are fantastic.   Dessert:  Their peach cobbler is the first dessert I've eaten there and I won't try anything else because I would gladly eat my way out of a vat of their peach cobbler.  The ambiance may not be to everyone's liking.  I don't care.  When the food is this good, the rest of the world fades away and it's just you and the deliciousness.  Try it for yourself if you don't believe me.

ddKsIp9DUM-aPkROogB_ow.text: Only giving one star because no stars are not an option. Food was horrible very bland! I have never tasted cabbage so bad! They literally just cut some cabbage up, cooked it and served it like that. Say far away from the cabbage.. Not was seasoned good at all  The staff was nice that's probably the only good thing I can say about this place! Besides the fact that a lady came outside in the rain to tell me the other lady in wanted me because she didn't charge me right! I go back in and she says I owe her .82 cent! WTF!!!!! I even tipped them a few dollars. I ordered my food to go which took forever! What a bad first impression! I will never go back to this place or recommended it. I spent $42 on two regular meals and a kids meal. I probably took 4 bites of the food!!!  Lo Lo's is wayyyy better!!!!!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Mrs White's Golden Rule Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Horrible!!!!! Waste of $$$ cabbage taste like hospital cafeteria food, think they forgot to add seasoning!

U8ji7VuU0WP0Sk-P0ygb6w.text: I'm giving Mrs. Whites one star because of the nice waiter that we had. I'm from Mississippi and this definitely wasn't soul food. Soul food speaks to your soul at first bite. This food was under seasoned to say the least. Black eyed peas when prepared correctly have a gravy to them, these had water. Yams have a caramelization of goodness and brown sugar, etc that cause your yams to separate  and these were whole sweet potatoes in water. Now to the Mac and Cheese... My grandmother would be mad. The highlight was the fried chicken which was okay to say the least.  Maybe soul food in Arizona taste differently from Mississippi. If you want  authentic soul food go check out J's Chicken and Waffles in Tucson. The best yams, fried chicken, greens, etc I've tasted since living Mississippi. His chicken is the best I've tasted in my life.

photos.caption: Photo of Mrs White's Golden Rule Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Look at these yams and macaroni and cheese... Very disappointed. Does not taste like southern soul food at all.

OACxxohWPF5tupkkM9wlQQ.text: Stopped in on a whim after a friend in my car said that she had been dying to try this place for the longest. We figured that we had a couple hours before we had to be anything to do, so we might as well stop in for a lunch.  We walked into the old restaurant and the first thing I noticed were the walls; they had signatures of famous celebrities, artists, and athletes who had stopped by for food scrawled in every corner of the place. There were only two other patrons in the place at 2pm on a Wednesday, so service was snappy and quick.   We were waited on by a couple waitresses who were pleasant and recommended us different dishes. I ended up getting the country fried steak and my friends both ordered the famous fried chicken. You get a couple sides with each order, and I figured I wouldn't forgive myself if I didn't give their sweet tea a try. No more than 10 minutes later, our food came out and the portions were HUGE. My friends got three gigantic pieces of chicken each, and my steak seemed bigger than my face. We have a ton of black eye peas and mac & cheese scooped onto each of our plates; even the sweet tea came in a bigger-than-normal glass!  None of us came close to finishing our plates. The food was tasty and we were definitely happy that we stopped on by. The plates are a little expensive at $13, but the ridiculous portions more than make up for that. I would definitely come back again (next time, I'll have to try the catfish and okra gumbo).

917sRVXeC89AAaONV2qkkQ.text: I really liked this place! The food was incredible. Chicken was hot and crispy and fresh...my son missed his drumsticks but he ate everything. Macaroni and cheese was creamy and sharp...cornbread fresh and hot out of the oven! The best cabbage EVER!!!! How can simple cabbage be soooo good? Greens were tasty and not over cooked. We didn't have room for dessert but I loved that it was free on Sundays! Service was polite and attentive. It's worth the wait if you love fried chicken. Lots of folks ordered pork chops too!

photos.caption: Photo of Mrs White's Golden Rule Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bones picked clean by my son

xEOfHwfMda2L54sn7lNw_w.text: This place has been here forever! Used be open only 5 days a week and cash only. Now open 7 days and take cards. Some of the best home/soul food around Everything is made when ordered so it comes out hot. All the visiting pro athletes come here for homestyle cooking when playing in PHX. Not a big place, so it can get busy at lunch. They're open for dinner now, too, but I have not been here for dinner. I typically get the fried pork chops, greens, and sweet potatoes. The fried chicken is really good too! All the Southern staples are available; red beans, black eyed peas, green beans, sweet potatoes, mixed greens, catfish, pork chops, and chicken. For dessert, peach cobbler. Not fancy but has never disappointed with the food. Family-owned and all very nice people.

photos.caption: Photo of Mrs White's Golden Rule Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fried pork chops, chicken, sweet potato, and greens at Mrs. White&#39;s. Normally, go for the double chops.

wAMaV8gDbMoBKKoHBCVZ_Q.text: THE BEST CHICKEN IN TOWN!  Now I've read reviews about the service and how long it takes...  Mrs White's is a hole in the wall place to eat where you feel like your neighbor is feeding you.  Very, very down to earth people you would sit down and have a beer with after a long day...  This place is not known for their fast service, like Capital Grill, they are known for their damn good food.  I don't know what they cook their green beans, but it's soooo good.  It reminds me of a fresh pot of pinto beans made with ham-hocks, amazing.  I recommend getting the chicken "smothered" or you will be picking off your friends plate for some gravy.  My second favorite side is the Mac and Cheese, let me top it off with some Koolaid! Again, if your looking for a place with fast service try elsewhere, but if your looking for some damn good food, this is the place that is worth the wait.

Ps1PFGt9Idw-7LF-VfAjUw.text: saw these guys on best thing i ever ate...and now i know why...heres my review,.. Cornbread...excellent Fried Chicken...great mac and cheese...great potato salad....great  service....fantastic...i mean really good...the hostess was a sweetheart...she greeted me with a smile and sat me right away...brought my drink and the cornbread immediately and the entree within 5 minutes...i was very pleased with my experience

EV9SiR9LQUrPvMMawZp8QQ.text: Took my girl here when she was in town and the food was great. The cook kept coming out to make sure we were ok. Not sure what the waitress was doing because she disappeared for a little bit but overall I would definitely recommend this place. Not too many soul food places in Phoenix.

LLVnt6ieYxRpnCxSns17aQ.text: Food is bomb!  The atmosphere isn't the best; but the food definitely makes up for it. I will definitely go again. I've gone just to get the peach cobbler.

dHHDqAwl92YB93ORKgR8gA.text: We went about 3 pm on a Saturday, place was close to empty. Not sure if that was bc of the heat or recent negative reviews but either way it was nice for us.   FOOD: I'll start with the most important part, the food!!! For the food alone, 5 stars!! I got the catfish sandwich and cabbage, so delicious. My hubby got fried chicken, mac n cheese, and sweet potatoes. Everything tasted great and the portions where big. My picky 2 year old ate half my catfish and his dads chicken, we were amazed at that alone. As others have said, the food took a long time to come out, about 30 to 45. When it came out, it was hot and fresh. Quality food will only cook so fast so I'm not going to complain too much about the wait.  SERVICE: Staff was prompt, friendly and very polite. Everyone seemed down to earth. To some they may seem a little too laid back which may come off as unprofessional, but we didn't mind. The food is southern style soul food, it isn't suppose to be served by uptight people in a suit and tie.   ATMOSPHERE: Its a small establishment which is cool but it still could use a little work. Booths were loose and barely enough room under the table. We kept stepping on each others shoes. For people with little kids this may be important. They only had 2 high chairs, both were dirty and could have used a quick wipe down by staff before being put back. Bath room could use a little remodel and felt like a sauna. I washed my hands and ran out. It was also warm in the dinning room. In a triple digit summer quality AC is a must!!   Overall, we liked it even with some issues here and there. We will be going back.

photos.caption: Photo of Mrs White's Golden Rule Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Toddler gives his approval

UHQ2NzPVcOYhXnSAwQfPxQ.text: This is not only the best Soul food that I've ever had, it's the Best fried chicken, macaroni and cheese and cabbage I've ever had in a restaurant!  The chicken was cooked to perfection, crispy, moist and flavorful. The cabbage was so good that my sister ordered a double of it. The Mac and cheese was just as delicious the last bite as the first. Each cheesy mouthful gave a burst of sharp, yet smooth heaven.  I can't describe it any better.  It's just that good!          It's a 'hole-in-the-wall, but don't let that deter you.  Like so many others it's worth checking out.  Your taste buds and purse will thank you !

photos.caption: Photo of Mrs White's Golden Rule Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fried Chicken, cabbage and macaroni and cheese. All, literally, the best I&#39;ve ever had in a restaurant.
Photo of Mrs White's Golden Rule Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mrs. White&#39;s Soul food restaurant in Phoenix, AZ. Absolutely Delicious!

f4-sQ-Tkc87DQ4E_4Gh_YQ.text: I had the chicken fried steak. It was bad. Thick. Not pounded out. Leathery. The coating fell off. They gave me sweet tea twice. I asked for unsweetened. Not sure if they were playing with me or simple. Even if graded on a curve, that dish wasn't good food or even soul food. Folks around Phoenix must not know better if this place has such a good and long reputation.

os1OYoXuFfYd0iKz16kDJA.text: OK, the fried chicken her is legit. Juicy, tender on the inside. Skin was nice and crisp as you bite into it. The sides were nothing spectacular however I did enjoy their coleslaw. To bad they don't sell just the chicken by the piece because I think people would go their just to buy a bucket of chicken and nothing else. They sell their food in plates. Pick a protein, choose two sides, and you get a piece corn bread. They cost about $13. I feel like we definitely got a lot of food. The place it self looks very old. Not well kept. Appears dirty. The servers were nice but the guy in charge seemed like he didn't care much about the customers. He was watching TV most of the time. Food also took a very long time to come out. Fyi they sell kool aid if you like to drink that with your meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Mrs White's Golden Rule Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken Dinner to go with 2 sides. Mac&#39;n cheese and cole slaw. Comes with corn bread. Kool-Aid additional cost.

48PObvrhbla-BZdlSr_K1g.text: I've never actually stepped inside the place but I had a few take out meals brought to me by my folks over the years. Whenever I bit into a piece of fried chicken or breaded pork chop, I get an image of a motherly woman painstakingly cooking for a large family.

5v5z8cEV9yVAXudzzwywIg.text: Great, great food. Lousy service. You are treated as an aftertought. Mr.White is constantly correcting the kitchen staff. If you don't mind crap service+great food....this is the place.

5YaV4ayIKHhti4vqd95gfA.text: This review is from someone raised in Phoenix, so my taste for heavy fried food isn't so accurate compared to my southern counterparts.  I give this a solid rating, if not just for the atmosphere.  Not your typical Phoenix establishment...very friendly, very homey.  I did feel like I took in more salt than I usually do in a month, but the greens were fabulous!  The chicken wasn't my ultimate favorite ever, but still better than anything you can find in the valley.

qCVt8TITGPVJVlHHYlgK4Q.text: Waited a long time to order but waited forever to get our food. The food was just so-so and not worth the wait.  The one good thing was definitely the kool-aid.

dnQLSAHEO0_YOEKRRWOOHA.text: The fried chicken is perfectly fried at Mrs. White's.  It's probably the best soul/southern food I've ever had!

eh79ZizofDxpecVWisOkSQ.text: I was introduced to this place by my chiropractor...we were coming from an event downtown and were talking about soul food and peach cobbler...he said that i should try Mrs. Whites and I was like ok lets go!  It is definitely not fancy but that is ok...its not meant to be...I love smothered chicken so when I saw it that is what I ordered!  It was awesome...then I was super excited for the peach cobbler and the owner said there was only tomato cobbler...I was like WTF?? Tomato cobbler?  He was like I bet that you will like it just as much or more then the peach cobbler...I was in the mood to try something new so I said bring it out...lol...they brought it out with ice cream on it...and it was nice and warm...I was still skeptical...I had never heard of such a thing!  I took my first bite and i was in heaven it was AMAZING!!  I cleaned the bowl!  I then apologized to the owner for doubting him...I still to this day have never had a tomato cobbler but I will always remember that it was awesome! This is not the place to go if you are on a diet...but try it...its right near downtown...

3PGMlvOuuAt85LpibMvTdg.text: Awesome food, the best place in Phoenix to go for soul food.  If you have good manners, you'll get good service( yes mam, please, thank you...etc)

T7pro6cOINuom1O0sIKXtg.text: Ahhhh.... the fried pork chops. I hadn't been to Mrs White's in about 5 years and was pleased to see that fame hasn't gone to anyone's head in there. Still the same wonderful homemade, fresh food that it's always been, served in the same comfortable atmosphere. I was surprised when the server handed me a menu, but happy to see that my old standbys - pork chops, cabbage and black-eyed peas - were still there and just the same. Yes, it's slow, but good homemade food takes time, people! Nothing here is microwaved, frozen or pre-prepared. It's exactly what "soul food" is supposed to be... food that feeds your soul. Thank you, Mrs. White's, for keeping it real.

MXiZeyZ3FpSAxYxIvHWj9Q.text: Actually found this place on Yelp! while reviewing another place. Saw all the good stuff said about the place so I gave it a shot since it is real hard to find soul-food in Arizona. Granted when I hit the parking-lot there wasn't a car out there besides a couple of vehicles parked near the back for the staff. When I walked in, the place was empty except for this kindly older gentleman who sat at the counter reading the paper, I assumed he was the owner or had something to do with restaurant because he greeted us as we walked thru the door. Turns out he was a customer like myself but must have been a regular as he played with the kid behind the counter and talked with staffed as they worked. Now remember I said it was empty but as soon as we placed our order it kinda started getting busy and when they brought our meals I seen why. I had the catfish with greens and red beans and rice as my sides. Mrs. White's hit me with 3 big pieces of catfish piping hot and crunchy on the outside flaky on the inside, and a big bowl of red beans and rice which were good with a hit of sweetness to them, never had red beans with a hint of sweet like that and then put me down with a big side of greens. My Wife had the fried chicken with mac&cheese and yams as her sides and she loved it! Needless to say neither one of us could finish had to get take home trays. Could not believe the portions for the money we paid! If you want the "Itis" this is the place to go.

photos.caption: Photo of Mrs White's Golden Rule Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. catfish,red-beans&amp;rice and greens
Photo of Mrs White's Golden Rule Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken,rice and greenbeans

UcM4jDk8WyX2qyfvTqLYGg.text: I loved eating here! It's VERY casual and the servers are super friendly. They made us feel very at home and did an awesome job. I think we tipped them a little more than 30%. The food is delicious, but very unhealthy. Don't go here if you're on a diet of any kind - I'm guessing that it is all very high in sodium, fat, etc. If you're in the mood for a treat, or if you love Southern food like me, it is perfect. I had the fried chicken, which was pretty good, and my date had the smother pork chop. I wouldn't recommend the pork chop (it was pretty tough) but I would absolutely 100% recommend the smothered chicken. They gave us a piece of smothered chicken with the pork and that was delicious. The restaurant itself isn't exactly beautiful, but the food is tasty and inexpensive and the service is wonderful.

rz26-2S2oWL5aJLxA4LaDQ.text: This is definitely a hole in the wall.  Don't expect fancy furnishings.  The air conditioner was not functioning or they just didn't want to turn it on because there wasn't that many people at the time.  They did bring an electric fan out.  I had the oxtail special.  The waitress said it was cook in its own sauce.  I suspect that it was slow cook or braised with very little liquid.  It was tender but with just a right tad of chewiness left in it.  So, the texture was perfect.  You had to work it just a little bit in your mouth and that's when the flavor releases into your senses.  The ligaments near the bones were just out of this world.  Yes, you have to gnaw at the bones to get to it.  The portion is generous.  I have two sides, green beans and yams.  The yam was good but the beans tasted like canned beans.  The corn bread was gritty and nice.  I also had a lemonade which was cool and sweet.    My friends had fried chicken, catfish, smother pork chops.  We all finished our plates cleaned.

rPEUYXbMlo_ffzn1nSDEuw.text: This was one of the better soul food places I've visited since I moved here. The food was excellent! I ordered the catfish, rice with gravy and cabbage. My girlfriend ordered the chicken-fried steak, rice and mac and cheese.  Both dishes were tasty, and the only reasons I give this place 4 stars are because of the lemonade and the hired help. With all of the homemade dishes, you'd think the lemonade would be as well. Instead, it tasted like that Tampico mess that Fry's carries. As far as the staff...they were friendly to customers, but horribly unprofessional toward each other.--at least the two younger staff. Although I'm all about feeling like I'm "at home", I'd rather not hear people bicker back and forth in the kitchen, shouting all the foul language you'd hear at a playground. (wish I could attach soundbytes)--In all, I was impressed and neither of those two complaints could keep me from going back. :)

Q_rfdYznDlCL3KZb0TvupQ.text: My wife & I only ate here once but it was disappointing in comparison with all the high accolades given. While the service & pricing was fine, we were not nearly so impressed with the quality of the food. I certainly would not rate it to be poor, but it was nothing worth repeating. We both felt it was just typical diner quality food. The fried chicken was similar to eating Church's. Sorry folks, I have no desire to return.

Nz1FDIziziBzOeQQRr-cXA.text: It's not just soul food. It's AWESOME SOUL FOOD!! This is home cooking and comfort food at its best. Dieters are not welcome here. I was in Phoenix for 4 days and ate here 3 times. Their fried chicken, smothered pork chops, collar greens, black eyed peas and rice were fantastic. The service was slow because of the place being so busy. But, their customer service made you feel like you were waiting for a meal from grandma. (the waitress kept on calling me "darlin'" and "sweetness") The decor consisted of autographs written all over the walls of famous people ranging from professional athletes to President Bill Clinton. On my last visit, I scarfed my food down so quick that the waitress felt like they didn't give me enough food. So, when I paid my tab. She gave me a to go box of dirty rice, fried chicken, collar greens and velvet cake for free. I think she did that because I told her it was my last night staying in Phoenix and that we didn't have soul food this good in the Bay Area.

TFXHeypF7oGMJJJp_CQr6w.text: Pork chops are off the chain good. nice staff and the gravy and rice keep you happy

vEKJcrEW8Jwhi-E4a3Ukug.text: well here is the thing...i have had some damn good soul food coming from la..the thing is i read the lots of reviews and so i went there with an open mind. ok i get there hard to find but once found ample parking in there lot and it was packed during lunch hour. i wanted the oxtails but all they had were chops and chicken. so chicken it is...very tasty, and crunchy. the sides were yams which were griss and canned for sure. the greens had sugar in them and i could not stomach them. the peach cobbler had just come out the oven. guess what? they burned it! the bottom was black! the inside was doughy. this is not good except the chicken. but than again i went to her sons spot ..lolo's chicken & waffles and it wasnt good.:(  if your ever in los angeles...go to m&m soul food and roscoes chicken and waffles.

TSz0SG2JNBwpIjETiBj0_g.text: FLIES & COCKROACHES everywhere, Gave it 1-Star because there was no option for 0-Stars. 15min to take our order, 20min to bring out water. BUGS in my food ,, Health Inspection SHUT THIS PLACE DOWN

oIeaP2E8yTXivmk5OUiQIQ.text: I was disappointed I have not been to this place in over 10 years. I would eat here all the time . Things definitely changed, I told my friend that this was the best fried chicken I have ever had in my life. It took about 30 minutes for us to just get our drinks on the table and the food was OK it wasn't bad but it wasn't their usual.

CbCr1sjWNieS0N0yaOK26w.text: Clutch af.  A rickety little yellow building nestled in a downtown ghetto comprise what I assume most pass by without notice or the eventual intent to enter.   Please believe: YOU SHOULD. Mrs White's is by far THE quintessential soul food provider of the entire valley.  I highly recommend you surrender all paper money to this women if your in the area.  If you are in the area I also recommend the wet pork chops with mixed greens and sweet potatoes.  Happy Dinning.

1vhOrbSwxAWPIk2PBDjrpg.text: Southern Comfort Food  I have wanted to try Mrs White's for some time, so today I put Mrs. White's on our agenda for lunch. We arrived about noon. We were greeted, seated immediately, and given the one page menu.   I  had already planned on ordering the chicken after reading all the yelp reviews however, I  was  unsure what sides to have. Mrs White's offers so many southern style sides, black-eyed peas, cabbage, collard greens, mac & cheese, rice and gravy, potato salad, and so much more.   On this visit I order the 3 piece chicken, potato salad, and rice and gravy. Our waitress reminded us that the chicken is made to order so may be a short wait.  As we waited we were treated  with cornbread and honey.  The cornbread was warm and made with real course cornmeal not processed cornmeal, it was very good.   Our chicken arrived in a short time and was served piping-hot. The chicken portion are big, three large pieces. The skin on the chicken was very crispy and had a lot of flavor. However, the chicken was just average, maybe I was expecting more and the gravy and rice lacked flavor, but the potato salad was delicious.  While dining, we noticed  that the tables were filled pretty regularly and the seats at the counter were filled the entire time. I like that the walls at Mrs White's were covered with white boards and felt pens were  available to leave messages on the boards. Parking is tight at Mrs White's but it's worth a visit.

PkG1FU2ODE658a8j3-vjbg.text: Chickens crispy. Mac n cheese is finger licking good. Love there rice and gravy. Corn bread is excellent. And when they do have desert, you are in for a treat.

5HPE-nSJOdG42uSiLphywQ.text: I had the veggie plate and everything was super delicious. I especially loved the greens and cabbage. My boyfriend had fried chicken and was nice enough to give me a leg. It was great too!

0O_pf_4wGYYXfbY7VuKerg.text: March 2019 Update on Mrs. White's Golden Rule Cafe.   CUT TO THE CHASE - the food is good and hot - but not fast. Plan on about one hour, more or less, depending on the crowd. The menu claims "Southern" here and there - no comment about that, but I'll say that the food is good home cooking. Regular ($13) choices are pork chops (smothered or "succulent"), (deep) fried chicken, catfish, and a vegetable plate. Oxtail is an occasional special ("Friday" said the waiter).   Two sides are served with each entree.  In addition to those listed below, Rice (with-gravy), Beans (red), Green Beans, Sweet potatoes, Potato Salad, Mac Salad, Mac-n-Cheese, and Cole Slaw are offered.   I arrived just before noon on a Monday morning. There were about 10 other patrons when I got there (a "half-house"). A regular, who regaled me about Trump and his party regulars in mid-80s Manhattan, had already been served. Service was steady and none too fast - but so far as I could tell they managed  first-in, first-served sequence.   As always the fare was very good. I have a special appreciation for the "sides" - I ordered the recommended cabbage and black-eyed peas to go with chicken-fried steak. I also ordered "mixed greens" (which looked like collards) which was very good, too.   The coffee was Folgers (or equal) and strong - served with half-and-half and/or sweeteners by request.   Cornbread, not noted on the menu, is served with all meals -   The cornbread was home-made - therefore not the typical over-sugared mess that comes out of most boxes.  Desert was a generous portion of Louisiana Crumb Cake.   BOTTOM LINE - this place is all about simple, well-prepared, country-cooking - a good place to have a leisurely no-fuss meal.

eoWVabuT64TUP4LxAyWCBw.text: The chicken was awesome! I expected like a baked Mac and cheese but it was still ok. I would go again because the season for the chicken was good. I'm not sure if the were short staffed or need training and organization. Seemed to be a bit of both. I'd say a good clean up and better communication between the employees would settle the wait time for the customers. Wait time was long but I'm glad I stayed to try the food. I wish these people well because I'd come back to try more food.

fb0bKfE9frWPoYuAA5T1Fw.text: I have been coming here for eight yrs . This was my last time. The place is now run down they cut back on the food portions. I used to get three large PCs of chicken cabbage potatoes mixed with green beans . Plus corn bread . I got two PCs of chicken two small legs no potatoes no corn bread and the cabbage and bean portions were small. So sad to see a legend establishment go down hill like this.

1wzHqa7SAp7KCVwm2aIYsw.text: Diamond in the rough. Don't let the looks fool you, the food is delicious! This is my Favorite soul food restaurant in Arizona. I live in Tucson but I always stop here whenever I'm in Phoenix. It's my understanding that LoLos chicken and waffels is owned my the son of Mrs. Whites. I discovered Lolos first, then heard about this place and I make sure to stop here whenever I'm in town! Cornbread comes with every meal. And the sweet tea and Koolaid is SWEET lol. The staff are always nice. I love the fried chicken and yams.

LrWDR5DDNwAh0pVcC1xdzw.text: Great southern comfort food, koolaid,  cobbler. All good and fresh. Best around for sure.

XwHGZ4l1gsKwATGuX28INg.text: The foos is good. I enjoyed it. However, the service leaves much to be desired and no matter how good the food is, it's not enough to come back. If you can get your food to go, do so cause it's not worth.

_abvGqIYcd43pDOsX8M9Ig.text: Mrs. White's was EVERYTHANG and more! I was ordering for 4 adults, had two fried chicken plates and two smothered pork chop plates. The pork chops were so tender that they could be cut with a plastic knife. The fried chicken was crispy. Make sure to go before closing. We went an hour before closing and they were out of many sides that we wanted but that wasn't their fault. We had orders of mixed greens, sweet potatoes, black eyed peas and rice and gravy. We also ordered banana pudding. It was watery but again because I went before closing, I won't subtract a star for that. Everything tasted so good. I imagine we were getting the bottom of the barrel! All and all great spot and we will be back!

hvTjpiSsMG40jYmr6MfjWQ.text: I'm from the south and I had THE best smothered pork chopped I think I've ever had. The gravy was perfect, and the outside so crispy. AND THOSE YAMS.....so savory and my mouth is literally watering... Place is dabomb.com

GC9dXqFni813uISRwj3T-w.text: Came today for lunch w a co-worker...SOOOO DELICIOUS!!!  The place is a cute little restaurant w lots of personal photos, writing on the wall; very cool to see all those who have eaten and left reviews on the wall!!  For lunch we both had southern fried chicken but we chose different sides.  She had the cabbage and red beans/rice, I had the mixed greens (collard and spinach) and the green beans/potatoes.  Both were served w corn bread.  I had iced tea, she had koolaid.    The food was FANTASTIC!!!  Everything we ate was soulful, delicious, and comforting to the max!!  On top of that, service was great!  Our waiter mentioned he was there alone today and he was BUSY.  He kept our glasses full and kept us informed...he was fantastic.    This is likely the best place I've eaten in months, for sure the best of its kind in Phoenix.  A definite must!

kk9uHEqYpx4de9iIo9-w8A.text: Oh where to begin... I Rate it a 0 Star!!! service is horrible horrible horrible !!!! walk in there's a sign that says wait to be seated so we stand there nobody greets us nobody says anything !!! it's about 1:30pm, there's customers but no one says a word finally I look at the girl behind the counter and I say do we seat ourselves and she says yes find a seat so we go and sit and sit and sit, A good 20 minutes goes by were completely ignored! no water no nothing !! so my husband gets up and walks to the counter and asks if we are supposed to order there or does someone come to the table she says I'll be right there he walks back to the table, she does not come right away she stops and takes an order for more corn bread for another customer at this point he's beyond starving, so he walks outside to the vehicle to get some cheese that he had bought at the store earlier to bring back in to nibble on at the table while we wait when he came back in she finally came to the table to take her order now it's been 35 minutes and we still haven't got OUR WATER OR ORDERED and he told her that he had to go get something to nibble on because he has low blood sugar and they hadn't even given us water long story short we waited another 15 minutes decided when we finally were going to get the food we WOULD NOT enjoy it we were so upset!  so we left as we were leaving the waitress was bringing us a side dish of one of our side orders, the cook met us out back in parking lot trying to tell us the whole order was ready we told him it was ridiculous we would never come back, and will spread the word!! 45 minutes wasted on a place that cares nothing about their customers!!!!

XSWom2FWSpExnamkqjMC_w.text: This place has potential. A restaurant doesn't need to be beautiful or spotless to be great. You can do without friendly service. All you really need is good food.   Myself, Dining Partner, and two others came around 12:30 on a Friday afternoon. We were maybe 1 group of 4 in the place. We got the 3 piece fried chicken with mac and cheese and collard greens as our sides. It took awhile but once it arrived, the food was good. We ended up getting a free piece of drenched chicken because the waiter couldn't remember who it went to. The drenched chicken was better than the fried chicken. They ran out of ice, so we had room temperature water and our cornbread came out after we had already finished our chicken. Maybe the waiter was new; he was definitely overwhelmed. I probably wouldn't return to eat-in but I think takeout would be the way to go.

-HNzn7RVY1zsHAgDszsknQ.text: Salty chicken. Red Beans are not red beans. Taste good but that's not red beans. Cabbage and greens were JUMPING good.

b2ziFBgvSVWba5gkpnlLFw.text: Proper southern food like fried chicken and fried pork chops. If you're someone who likes collard greens and okra and such, then you're home.  I went with the regular fried chicken, which was a good portion of three pieces, properly battered and very crispy. As good as any chicken I've had in the Southeast. The green beans were a little overdone but the mac & cheese was excellent. Firm, tangy, and some of the browned edges in my bowl. Yum!  I was a little worried that they were cash only, but yes, they *do* accept cards.

-tQwiQlWj1JXRWSsEO-34w.text: First time customers--came for their famous Catfish. Excellent--not disappointed! Definitely will return to try Fried Chicken soon, and bring friends. Loved the Greens--tasty, freshly homemade. Larry White was a very friendly host, personable, genuine! This is a great family business, run with hard work and pride.

A3vmHpqf69BYn2QmNrD-FQ.text: The food was great! I am sorry grandma, but Mrs. White has got you beat. The fried chicken is incredible and the sweet potatoes and  greens were fabulous. Its not a fancy place, but the service is great and they made me feel welcome. I left stuffed and happy!

2coW0h3CEmJUtRJZg8H6QA.text: This place charges $15 a PLATE for a meat and two sides....that would be fine if it were in a comparable location and somewhere you wouldn't mind eating in...instead the place is dirty, old and they charge for EVERYTHING....debit card usage - there's a charge for that (which is illegal)..if you specify which pieces of chicken you would like instead of what they give you - that's a extra charge...if you use the ATM machine located inside etc....  The food itself is BLAND...in case anyone hasn't noticed, the candied yams and greens are from a can - called GLORY, yes you too can have this at home, the gravy is bland and lack seasonings...if you get red beans and rice - there's your 2 sides...it's not a combo like one would expect.  Overall the chicken and anything else here fried is great, but the box mix cornbread (May be Jiffy but it taste like Glory also) and "urban" decor is a no-go. If you spend $50 for 2 ppl to eat (which you will here if you get a drink) you're better off going for a descent steak dinner instead.  I'm sure these folks have remained in business due to the businesses in the surrounding area and "other" folks that don't know what True soul food tastes like (see Amera's review lol) so they are more than happy to hand over their money and call it THE BEST THING EVER...But Mrs. White and her friends/family (whoever works the place) would be laughed out of other authentic soul food/Southern areas of the country..  This is the equivalent to Taco Bell serving Mexican Food and calling themselves Carolina's.

6c8bwJEvpF9IZH_HcEVgxA.text: It was good but not great.  Went there for an early lunch at 1130am.  The chicken was great.  Lots of big pieces.  However it tool almost 45 minutes to get served and I thought it was a bit expensive.  The 3 peice meal and a drink came to over $17 plus tip.

bJSmQ2cP99F8SOAcM5BYyw.text: Disappointed at the service. After going to LoLos for years, finally brought my family to Mrs Whites.  One server working on a busy Sunday (post church), and waited (along with the rest of the restaurant patrons) for almost two hours! Food quality was less than par (going to LoLos from now on.)

GDHTJXQ3Xb7lk3vaBRYl0Q.text: Big portions.  Really good chicken!  Not the best I've ever had but it's up there in top 3 for sure.    Everything was nicely seasoned and the veggies were delish - I opted for the greens and the blackeyed peas.  I would actually consider the veggie plate and skip the meat because the sides were soooo good.  The cornbread was really, really good crumbled into the peas.    Gargantuan size kool aid too!  A worthwhile stop!

SIrisNW5DNNS-OtjRKlF3Q.text: Best soulfood in Phoenix..The Service was great .The greens ,sweet potatoes &  fried chicken was amazing .besides the dry cornbread everything was on point . ill definitely come again ..

UODQ9MueBMGfO6DifwGg8A.text: A few people from work and i walked in to try this place out since I've heard of it for years via TV news shots, etc. My friends and I were basically ignored as all the employees were just hanging around talking but were finally asked if we'd like a table which seemed obvious but apparently not. Got a table and ordered some of the toughest chicken fried steak I ever not been able to eat. My friends were equally disappointed and we all left hungry. The people didn't seem surprised we left so much on the table, must be used to this. Needless to say: been there, done that, won't return...

9ZvReUEURjmHvgEmHGz4jw.text: Someone PLEASE explain to me why this place gets written up as one of Phoenix's best. So disappointing!   I was really eager to try it out. My husband and I stopped in one Friday night hoping for some kick-ass Southern (he's a Southern boy, I've eaten in joints all over the South). We got a waitress who was dumber than a sofa cushion (bless her heart) who took our order verbally, then had to come back and ask what we'd ordered. I suggested that she get a pad and write it down. She still screwed it up. We waited ... and waited ... and waited ... and finally asked for some cornbread to keep the ol' blood sugar up. Took three times asking the server and the cook who also seemed to be a server. Oy. So heavy if it fell off the table it would kill the cat.  He had the chicken-fried steak, a favorite of his. He gave it a 3 out of 10. At least it was hot. He gave the sweet potatoes higher marks, but was put off by the amount of liquid butter in the bowl (and this is a man not afraid of butter).  My pork chops were lukewarm, bland and tough - they reminded me of the old Shake N Bake, except they had no seasoning that I could discern. I'd asked for the gravy on the side; it was okay, like something you'd make at home. But it took four requests for a spoon, and then I got up and went to the counter to ask for one. What really chapped my britches was the rice: plain white rice, like Uncle Ben's Converted, with not a speck of flavor. No seasoning, not even salt that I could taste. I was having school cafeteria flashbacks.  Okay, the cole slaw was respectable, but I've had just as good from a grocery store kit.  Atmosphere is supposed to be quaint and authentic - I call it grubby and beat-up, and not in a cool, hot 'n happening way.  Go to Welcome Diner if you want good, cheap Southern-inspired food, or if you don't mind a bit higher check, go to Lolo's Chicken & Waffles (which, BTW, is owned by the grandson of Mrs. White).

K_LOHE1KdqJXdDTQnTjkNg.text: Moved to PHX a year ago and this is one the best meals we've had, definitely the best FRIED CHICKEN!  We had their fried chicken meal.  I also had the green beans and macaroni and cheese.  Both were wonderful.  My husband had the sweet potatoes and cole slaw.  We were there for lunch and am ready to go back for dinner!  The sweet tea was perfect, not too sickly sweet and the peach cobbler was perfectly homemade.  Can't wait to return to Mrs. White's!

1Lpr2nC3Mr4mcm5lckVrrw.text: Fried chicken was great, cabbage was great, potato salad was great, cornbread was good.  This is a good spot to check out, doesn't look like much on the outside, but the food is great.  I'd definitely come here again.

W5iqvVBsk_QlGtMps-NZRA.text: I just came here on a Sunday after talking this place up  only to be disappointed. We not only sat for 30 plus waiting for our food but they decided to tell us after placing order they didn't have chicken!!! So when did you figure that out? They offered some peach cobbler as a peace offering but we declined. I don't see myself EVER going  now.

btHWRs1DUtyZMRXVYxM0ng.text: Overall, this place is pretty good.  The price is a bit high, but I enjoyed the fried chicken and chicken fried steak that I had here.  On the down side, the black eyed peas tasted like the canned variety and I felt the cornbread was a tad too dry.  I would also avoid this place on a busy day - fresh fried food takes awhile.  I think Lolo's and Golden Rule are run by the same family (or are related somehow) and the two are quite similar. In my opinion Lolo is a full star better though, and if you are reading Yelp to decide between the two then I would recommend passing on Golden Rule.

n9xwGHk62rS3hShQErLhFw.text: First time eating soul food... my fabulous boss brought me here for a lunch meeting. s-wZN_AqdZpwcqc6Ny-j2g.text: Food was awesome! Fried chicken was crispy and not at all greasy. Cabbage was a little sweet which was different but good. Sweet potatoes were just sweet enough.
