TH60PGpIjcg0x_qN37T0nQ.text: Can't get enough ... Taste like grandmas cooking   My order -catfish (which is to die for)  Mixed greens & Mac & cheese DELICIOUS

Y7JTfr3IvVeEzluf5Jpg0A.text: The food was amazing!!!!! the service wasn't great. They messed up our order multiple times and by the time some of us got our food others had completely finished. Regardless, the food was so good that I STILL give it 4 stars. AMAZING!!

SA124IrfT3MLhGVPOp5OzQ.text: fortunate to have had a diverse foodie/lifestyle past, part-dive-y/upscale college hangouts by South Bay/Wedtwood in LA, way too expensive for me now places in the Philippines, Indonesian, Ethiopian, etc., Brazilian churrascarias, beloved Portuguese bakery in Burbank, Inka's Peruvian in Santa Monica, hole-in-wall Baja tacos in Redondo beach, Malasadas in Maui, Tito's tacos, Persian pizza, to name a few --and a lot of Soul food experiences from homemade at a few grandma homes to Original LA chicken /waffles at Roscoe's (sorry Lolos)..and after all that -- THE best fried chicken outside of a sweet person cooking for you -- is hands down Mrs. Whites. Accolades well-deserved...Mic drop worthy & a wonderful institution downtown of which to be proud.

zPce4H6bLWY8ILDFgOHBmA.text: A great family business run by great people. I walked in late tonight to try and get some dinner to go only to find the business was closed. However the owner (I am assuming) came to the door and asked what I wanted and then invited me in and saw that I was able to get my food still. A really classy thing to do when she could have just said they were closed for the evening and my food was still fresh and amazing. You won a customer for life in my book :).

Kl_ryY9G3W7dvVBuGvbsBA.text: we love going there. food is super..fried chicken great and all sides perfect. nice staff. we met the REAL Mrs. White and she is so cute and very nice. we go as often as possible.  real soul food baby..nothing like it

JxxvkOmexZhIlWoXWFiQrQ.text: My wife loves soul food.  When I brought her to Mrs. White's, she was sold.  The atmosphere was small and felt quite authentic.  We sat and ordered fried chicken.  I had Kool -aid (red), which I have not had since I was a kid.  I forgot how delicious the red concoction was.  About 40 minutes later, our fried chicken platters came out.  My wife first said "We could have split one"  ("No we could not...get your own" I thought to myself).  The chicken was divine.  My wife magically ate all three pieces by herself.  She believes that her hands grew a mind of their own and force fed her all 3 parts, but we know better.  She raved about how delicious everything was.  I liked the chicken a lot.  The only thing that would have made the place a bit more authentic would have been some jazz or blues playing in the background.  OK, the place was fine.  Not fancy or frilly.  In fact, you can pull out a pen and leave your mark on the wall as many others have.  Try it.  Its worth the drive downtown.

XoxiY8NXU6mgY7Sk8chI3A.text: Okay here's an update. I've been back to Mrs. White Golden Rule. I can admit the food was becoming very inconsistent in its flavor but this weekend I had a veggie tray and it was done just right! Please keep whomever is back there... they have something right! This is the 2nd Sunday's that we've been blessed with this cooks exquisite fine cooking of soul food! As much as I'd love to give 5 stars, the cornbread is still lacking something but this minor setback won't stop me from visiting Mrs. Whites Golden Rule

cL8c3f27EjnNlb5_9zZ6VQ.text: Drove into Phoenix today and headed straight to Mrs. White's.  It seems we were a bit early, and we had to wait outside while it opened.  An employee came outside while we were waiting to grab a smoke.  He was friendly and started up a bit of conversation with my husband about the place.  It turns out he was one of the cooks.  When were able to finally get in, we were offered drinks, and ended up getting sweet tea, which I don't care for.  I got the smothered pork chop and two sides, the mac and cheese and the black eyed peas.    We got a corn cake to eat while we waited and when the meal came it was pipping hot and very good. Service was excellent and prices were reasonable.  I recommend this place for some True southern food.

r-Mn7XcbgE54c0juexlONg.text: This place is heaven on earth. I tried the fired chicken and it was absolutely amazing. They give you good portions and always made to order. If you like Lo Lo's then you'll love this place too!

Eqi6h8_Ih5Nig17lovpBUg.text: It's not 5 star dining but it's exactly what I was looking for. Some good food with a simple menu, you can't go wrong!

2e04iKbvaRXHzLbFJPWxmw.text: I'm not sure what is worse; ordering my food to go, eating fried chicken, eating fried chicken in the heat, or all of the above.   Well, rain or shine, I love eating Fried Chicken and nobody can take that away from me. So I saw this little bungalow-like restaurant, which is located a block away from Chase Field and also not far from my hotel, that serve authentic Southern and Soul food. But my dining experience and decision-making has costed me my hopeful solid meal.  I ordered the Fried Chicken dinner-combo for $12.00. The combo includes two sides with a slice of cornbread and I chose Rice and Mixed Collard Greens. I made a big mistake and opted to take my meal to-go to stuff my face with the fried chicken like a barbarian in my hotel room. My side of Collard Greens were very tasty and full of flavor, but a bit too watery, in which caused my side of rice to taste like a soup-like side and my monster-pieces of fried chicken's crispy skin and piece of cornbread were soggy. The fried chicken were very tasty, but it would've tasted a lot better if it wasn't for my misfortune.   This restaurant accepts only cash. I should've ate in the restaurant, because the friendly workers treated me very well and strongly convinced me to eat in. I'll definitely will eat in the restaurant  next time.  The restaurant has numerous awards from various sources including having the famous Yelp-sticker posted on the front door. The restaurant is also a favorite of the NFL's Arizona Cardinals, and NBA's Phoenix Suns with numerous pictures posted all over the facility.

photos.caption: Photo of Mrs White's Golden Rule Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States

2h9gRkj2Y7e6sQR-T_m7mQ.text: Hearty meals and very filling. I prefer baked mac, but all else is pretty good. My only issues is that they're always out of desert...it's like just take desert off the menu LOL. I'd say at least try them out!

V6wrSAL5jpVpFa8Tk_IYLw.text: This place looks as plain as the food tastes. I could get a 3 piece meal at KFC with a drink for half the price of what  I paid for lunch here. 14.00 vs 7.00....  Just because it's homemade doesn't make it better....  The only thing good here was the Coleslaw (taste like KFC).  Keep your money and move on. There are plenty of places besides this one that serve much better food and service it's just not Mrs Whites :-(

mA4QPior1Z3QzAG2wh5r0g.text: This place was off the hook with Flavor. Takes a while to get the fried chicken as they cook to order. Very rustic place, it is family owned.  The mixed greens were SOOO full of Flavor and the Black eyed peas were some of the best I've ever had. I left there totally stuffed. Nice portions. Many NFLers, MLBers, and musicians have signed the walls. Cool reading.

photos.caption: Photo of Mrs White's Golden Rule Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States

wAFvza55AmzAV7mvhOAGLA.text: Came here based on Foodnetwork's  TV show: The Best Thing I Ever Ate. The fried chicken was ok, skin was nicely crisped, but the seasoning was not marinated through the meat itself. So, it was rather bland. I really liked the side dishes, though.

photos.caption: Photo of Mrs White's Golden Rule Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Mrs White's Golden Rule Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Mrs White's Golden Rule Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States

rtP2kvQT3_j-s7SD-E4DHg.text: I came here years ago before a lady Gaga concert (great show). It was empty when we walked in and we ordered some drinks. We ordered our food and it took literally 2 hours for it to come out. There was no one in the resturant so I don't know why it took so long. I think whoever was working left. I won't come back here

b-t91zTWXlPXZzZZzBGR-w.text: So let's see I had heard great things about the Fried Chicken here....well it was True.  Sides (Mac n cheese & Coleslaw).....very good.....homemade even.  Lemonade Kool-Aid.....hmmmmm.....a little to sweet for my taste but wasn't bad  Free Refills.....very nice......ummmmmm.  Service.....good....staff very friendly.....but don't really earn there tips.  Location right across the street from Chase Field....perfectly awesome for me.  Parking Lot a bit small....but there is street parking....however be careful of that.  The building itself is very small.....like a shack almost....but not terrible.  Public Transportation nearby....that is a plus for those who live downtown.  Pricing could be better.....3 pieces of chicken....2 sides.....and Cornbread....13 bucks.  They do take debit but there is 1.00 charge I think to use it.....that is pretty terrible....but since everything was pretty good we didn't complain. We also had a groupon deal 10 bucks we paid for 20 bucks worth of food....but with the pricing of the food we barely broke even....so don't know if it is worth it. All in all in was a pleasant experience....but unless you live downtown or are attending a game driving here just for soul food....might not be your best option. Eat, Drink, and be Merry my Friends!!!!

bdYnVOrYiVZFrAqFsV9-7Q.text: The original chicken that started it all and spun off LoLos. Amazing, quirky, hole in the wall. Bad staff, lousy seats, super slow service...it's all part of the, charm? Always. Love it.

photos.caption: Photo of Mrs White's Golden Rule Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States

NSsfYMkw3mDixtVt9iRjxQ.text: First time here. Literally everyone that came in after us got their food before us. There were a few of them who actually were able to get their food and eat it all before we were served. It was freezing and I wouldn't not recommend coming here. The food is good, but not good enough to sit around for an hour and a half while everyone around you gets there food before you. Also they were out of like half our their menu which is only like 6 items.

McuIw-FxiNbSZvw2Adgn6g.text: The reviews were spot on. Great Fried Chicken. Nice friendly staff. The Sweet Potatoes were awesome as were the Black-eyed peas. I will be back

photos.caption: Photo of Mrs White's Golden Rule Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fried Chicken with black-eyed peas and sweet potato

DvEZW8hjOa0A6vSAZ2YBkg.text: Real southern style soul food that is reasonably priced. The kool aid is sweet, and the staff have the right attitude.

kZucRtpEGUyWI2mmFSPs_g.text: R U N!!!!!!       R U N !!!!!!      I repeat run!!    Atrocious and utterly  Disgusting customer service......even for simple  to-go orders!! I stopped by to place an order for lunch.  A polite young lady greeted me at the door and once she went behind the counter to take my order,  a large unkempt wholly mammoth looking creature with a grey beard came up also and demanded that I take a seat and the young woman tried to explain to him I was getting a to-go order.  Ignoring her comments......The guy begin to filibuster about how they have to cook the food. (And I guess hunt for it).  It was very bizarre and I didn't feel safe ordering anything from here,  (given the owner would  let  someone with prison inmate like customer  service skills manage the front counter....heck maybe that was the owner, that's usually how it is).   Also, no reason to go somewhere where you feel as though you're in apprehension of receiving a battery.   This was my first visit here and  I sensed the business owners play off the fact that AZ doesn't have many soul food eateries,  so they feel  they can treat customers anyway they want and they will keep coming back.   Not I.  Being from the south, im use to soul food restaurant staff having  a lil rudeness or curt like customer service skills.....but this situation was more like a scene from the tv show "OZ". If you don't mind being spoken to like you're on cell block d, in a restaurant that is seemingly unsanitary,  with numerous safety code violations on the outside...eat here.  #buthideyourspoons   #lowdowndirtyshame

XlRLwy6v-090qku262M13A.text: I was very disappointed today in the service,food overall & the long time to get our food. (1.5 hours). There were only two other tables & they were served before us. The five dinners were brought out one by one. To think I came here on my birthday to celebrate?! Should of gone to Lolo's as the rest of the gang wanted to. At least Lolo's can say thank you & sorry. And....no cooler or A/C in the back part of the restaurant.

CYwkr6z4XCSgJWBo8UMwWg.text: On a spring break trip with our son who wanted fried chicken. We googled "best fried chicken in Phoenix" and this place was #1 on the local paper's "Top 10 Fried Chicken spots."  They weren't wrong. Chicken is succulent, tender and flavorful. I got the chicken fried steak which was so yummy. These people know what they're doing. Between us, we got the red beans, Mac salad, potato salad and Mac-n-cheese as sides. All were fantastic. It's small...maybe 12-13 tables. Basically, you feel like you went to somebody's house for the best, home cooked you've had in a long time.

qfwX5J4rXVjL8bDC13aYgw.text: Decided to stop in for lunch after doing The Urban Slide (large slip n' slide) event a block away. It was Sunday and about 1:20 and still had quite the crowd. I decided to order the Fried Chicken with Cabbage and Mac n' Cheese and my boyfriend ordered the Fried Chicken Sandwich w/applesauce. Well, we got our food and I had PLENTY of chicken (3 pieces) and good amount of sides. Well, my boyfriends chicken sandwich was two pieces of wheat bread with two pieces of fried chicken (leg and wing - with bones) on top of the bread. It really wasn't a chicken sandwich which was kind of disappointing. I gave him my chicken breast and took his leg. We both had ran out of water and asked for more but the server only brought us one glass so we shared that. While the chicken was very good and so were the sides I would be back but maybe not have the chicken sandwich (since it really wasn't a sandwich).

X5k07ThYTTplC5AOESUOkA.text: Great food, the fried chicken is THE BEES KNEES. Seriously. Get the sweet potatoes as well. You will have a good experience. The location is a little falling apart (the bathroom sucks) but you aren't there for that. You are there for that amazing golden taste.

YvcLfskTi9o2dDFTnYZ7gg.text: Hate to say, but the quality has fallen. This used to be the go to place for Soul Food, but both  service & food has dropped. We have been going since it was on 16th & Jefferson. The fried chicken was almost raw, i told the server and she got mad. We waited for a long time for the corn bread thinking it was going to be fresh, it was cold. What a shame,

p3NN6ZoN_3IZMHn8CFaU1w.text: We visited on a Sunday afternoon, and it was busy. Not gonna lie, our visit was not perfect but I enjoyed the food and highly recommend it. The problem was (which is no ones fault) they were unexpectedly busy and the were not prepared. But honestly that has no bearing on how great the food is here. They ran out of some popular items and couldn't keep up on the fried chicken orders. But again did not take away from our experience.  My grandma or maw maw as we called her was from Arkansas and the chicken, mac & cheese, green beans and potatoes took me back.  It did fall a little short in the fried chicken area because in two orders we did not get any breast pieces. Which for me is the money shot. I was not fan of the cornbread but that is just because it's not what I grew up on. My family makes it a little drier and less sweet. My daddy would of called that cornbread cake!  This business has been a staple in the community since 1964 with a lot of changes and development happening all around the Golden Rule. But it still remains True to it's past. Which in my opinion is wonderful to see. The waitstaff is amazing. I wish I could remember the servers names because they both did a fabulous job.

GOZq-5sSYA86b4wq3FkTpw.text: Ok if i had a mom that cooked greens this is what they would be like. Best fried chicken in az hands down mac n chez wow potato salad the bomb green beans hello......

photos.caption: Photo of Mrs White's Golden Rule Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Mrs White's Golden Rule Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States

2flFAb4C0Xc-tS-jlncGkQ.text: A Phoenix icon. One simply cannot miss their home cooked Southern food &  hospitality. Mr had the catfish, Mrs the fried chicken. Vegetarians take heart, the authentic sides are cooked meat-free. Sides of cabbage, macaroni & cheese, & the fried okra are favorites. As are the desserts. They can run of these by dinner time.   So write your name on the wall & leave your legacy. Ordering the red Kool Aid drink will evoke your inner child & solidify their family tradition.

8cHZgYjYW4uLhZ95S6k9iQ.text: This is one of my husbands favorite places to eat. I ordered the catfish with rice and gravy with collard greens.  My meal was delicious. I will Most definitely be back. My husband loves the smothered chicken.

B8F62I8CT5_ztqRkwcAUkg.text: Let me lay this out: Come here for the food. Not the service. Not the cleanliness. Nothing else, but the food. This has the best friend chicken in all of Phoenix.  I heard of this place when talking to a few people around the area. They warned me that it a little run down, but its all about the food.  We ordered smothered fried chicken, green beans and mac and cheese. BEST FRIED CHICKEN IN PHOENIX... idk what they put in the breading, but its amazing. The mac and cheese is the cheesiest. I honestly couldnt tell you what was better, the chicken or the sides.  The service is a little slow, we had a few different servers during the meal but they were all so friendly.  Again, come for the food, because in the end, thats all that matters!

photos.caption: Photo of Mrs White's Golden Rule Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States

gN6yFYEwHEmbonsvKgXVdA.text: This place was interesting to say the least. I got the whole "authentic" feel they were going for with ppls writing on the walls, but the place looked a little run down. (That's not what turned me away b/c most y good places are hole in the walls). Food- I had high expectations.. and considering that I waited an HOUR... Let me back up.. the Customer service was appalling! Now I'm familiar with what it looks like when you're short staffed.. but this place had one girl for a busy place (so we cut her some slack on the time it took) after an hour of waiting (and we see other ppl who got there after us LEAVE) We inquire from within.. little did we know, our order wasnt even placed! The cook or sous chef I believe then comes out batter everywhere in her hands.. and apron  and semi apologized as she hollering to me from behind the counter asking what'd I order again "mac & what". Then she says "look I'm sorry but she is new and I only have one fryer (with an attitude) after an hour and a half.. we got our food and it was handed to us with an attitude.. it wouldve been nice if they said "sorry we messed up, this ones on the house" nope!   So I finally get to the food.. and its mediocre. The cornbread had no flavor.. not sweet at all and it was cold. The mac and cheese was ok but I've had better.. the black eyed peas was under salt and the smothered chicken.. the skin was soggy from the sauce and it skin just wasnt crunchy enuf. I never write reviews this long.. but I just want to save you the time.

vQz4iKhrW87hEMmcXR_qVQ.text: The food is decent to taste, server was pleasant; establishment could use some up keep.

photos.caption: Photo of Mrs White's Golden Rule Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States

qw2jvEW5JFygIKZRMYraDg.text: Great place for southern food. Juicy crunchy fried chicken. Creamy Mac and cheese and really good corn bread. The kool aid was super sweet. Family owned and operated. Friendly place.

photos.caption: Photo of Mrs White's Golden Rule Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Mrs White's Golden Rule Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Mrs White's Golden Rule Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States

DdQw8MUUREAvva5QSpoWnQ.text: I arrived first from our party and waited to be seated, saw it was super busy so just waited, one of the servers then bypassed me and asked the couple BEHIND me if they wanted to go ahead and find a table they can sit and she'd go clear it.  I had to ask if I can take a table too, she said she didn't see me and to speak up next time.  I'm not a small person couldn't be overlooked.    Went and sat, waited forever for a nice lady who was volunteering to clear off tables.  We gave our parties full order as we were still waiting for them to arrive.  They arrived and EVERYONE got their food first and my and my cousin's irder (who PLACED the orders) were forgotten.  Waters never came, side dishes were forgotten then told when asked about then they ran out.  We were offered corn bread after everyone basically had finished and was still forgotten then the woman brought out a plate full of cornbread and two plates (we were 6 people) and asked us to pick a piece of bread off the plate, realized we all wanted some and set the full plate on an empty table and left again.   It was like she was letting us take our bread then taking the plate of leftover bread back to the kitchen or something.  After we were told they missed our two orders it still took another 20+ minutes to get it due to a change in chefs schedule and it was overlooked .  We asked for it to go.  It basically took over an hour and change to get food and it wasn't busy anymore .  The chicken was good but wound up bringing it home because everyone was finished with their whole meal and we had to leave.  I have soggy leftover chicken instead of fresh hot crispy juicy chicken.

6aVKjntZol2WeRiCtjApLg.text: I had dinner here one night last week. The restaurant is located very close to Chase Field and has its own dedicated parking lot in back. There is also a rear entrance if you use the parking lot or you can walk around and come in the front door. I ordered the 3 piece fried chicken meal with sides of black eye peas and rice and brown gravy for about $13. The meal came out in about 15-20 minutes. The fried chicken was very good along with the peas and rice. I really enjoyed the meal. My only complaint was that I was given 2 wings and a thigh. I can understand 1 wing but not two.give me more meat! I mentioned that to the waitress and she agreed that the kitchen made a mistake and gave me my drink for free.   I believe this is a very good soul food restaurant. The fried chicken is scrumptious and I recommend you try it. They have a dining room to eat in and the table service was friendly.

photos.caption: Photo of Mrs White's Golden Rule Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fried chicken dinner

7-_mnfP2CyxLNect7pAiAQ.text: My family and I decided to try this place, given that we were visiting Phoenix.   We placed three orders:  1. Mrs White's fried chicken - with potato salad and mixed green. 2. Smothered fried chicken - with Mac and cheese  3. Smothered fried chicken with black eyed peas and green beans/potato.  4. Mrs White's fried chicken -   1st Order: They served three small chicken legs, with a cup of potato salad... the waitress said "The mixed greens are going to take too long, you want to changed for something else?" ....   Note: you would've thought to tell me this 45 mins earlier.   2nd order:  After waiting for over 30-45 mins. Another waitress said to us that they run out of Mac Cheese...   3rd order: this was fine   4th order: NEVER came... when we asked to put it in a to go box.... 15mins later the lady came back and said "We forgot to placed the order"  They served us corn bread... it was super hard even though they said was fresh.   Expensive! Each dish is $13! The quality is terrible!  Service was horrible, careless, even though we told them it was our first time there.   I'll never go to this place again. I do not recommended!

Hu6qBIct5OYrdfSdtlHVlg.text: I had the pork chop and the fried chicken.  Both were amazing.  They didn't have greens yet, but the cabbage was a good substitute.  The lady serving the tables was very friendly!  THE CORNBREAD IS AMAZING.  They forgot to give me my cornbread on my to go order and I drove all the way back from the airport to get it.

photos.caption: Photo of Mrs White's Golden Rule Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Catfish fantastic

Bz7yHRSz4096weAIUGquHg.text: The pork chop and country fried steak were amazing.  The Mac n cheese was pretty special too.  I prefer my Mac n cheese to be really creamy and cheesy.  Their Mac was neither but just had a solid seasoned and cheese flavor.  The gravy was awesome.  I had rice and gravy also and I loved it. It's a must do.  Just don't look for soda.  You'll be drinking sweet tea or kool aid.  Great place!

photos.caption: Photo of Mrs White's Golden Rule Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Mrs White's Golden Rule Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Mrs White's Golden Rule Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States

V1hCPcebGNsigG-1aDcOoQ.text: Father's Day ruined sat down asked for non sweet tea, got sweet tea instead the waitress said she was coming right back to take our order...the waitress never came back to take our order!  Sat and listen to staff talk about random subjects while the table next to us kept getting the wrong order and reordering all the while we wait. We got up and left while the heavy man seating behind the counter yells out in a condescending manner thank you I plan on never coming back here ever! PS life time South Phoenix native.

QfijXLxjVJVl1B9ytaS4MQ.text: I thought it would have been better. It was ok. This place was hyped up on food network so I checked it out .

3X2IAFWlXiFTeiFrsqeJEQ.text: I wanted to like this place, I really did. I was excited to try a different soul food place outside of the usual spot I go to just to have different options around the city. However, deviating from my go to spot for some good old fried chicken and cornbread turned out to be a dud.  We came in for dinner on a game night and was seated rather quickly, which was good, but that was where the good ended.   A little wait was expected as this was dinner time but for some reason, the hostess/waitress didn't anticipate this? Loudly proclaiming "damn, all y'all wanna come in at the same time?"   Granted they may or may not have been short handed that night but hearing that out loud upon arrival was odd.  Another odd moment was when the waitress couldn't remember the order of the patrons coming in and even acknowledged it out loud. As she took orders she ended up skipping over tables that were clearly seated prior to others.  Long story short, the food took over 40 minutes to arrive, it didn't taste good, and I enjoy a good slice of cornbread from soul food joints but this place just wasn't it, the cornbread was like chewing on paper.   Again, I wanted to like this place I really did, but the golden rule after this experience is to just stay away.

hdmE28xLKm2gpJdngZTBYA.text: Best fried chicken, best greens, and of course.. kool aid available. Crazy place. Not fancy, opposite of that. Some may be turned off by the facility. But great food and friendly people. I say make this a stop as you take your rental car back to airport. It's close by. You'll be glad you did.

TVxWNUidmyghOWOoIXEJCQ.text: Just a simple little place with a wonderful dynamic that is hard to find. Their food is made just as Mrs White wanted it and you can taste the love that the food is made with. I had the fried chicken and it comes with two side but you can't just stop at two. I had the cabbage, macaroni and cheese, Cole slaw, black eyed peas, greens, and sweet potatoes. So much flavor packed into each little bite.  I have to say if you are bougie and need a classy place, please go elsewhere. You do not come here for the service, Make sure you get it to go if that's the case. This is what Mrs White wanted and it's the way the place will stay.   It's about the food not the ambiance:

7aLSAZBCD32uQV-tmly0Fw.text: I'm from the south so I know good Soul food. Not only is this great soul food but it's possibly the only way lace in phoenix that knows how to season food correctly. Don't let the decor turn you away. What they lack in ambiance, they make up for in flavor. This is a must go!

9rVZHkvjVe-oX3pn3gsL5Q.text: We ordered the fried and smothered chicken, chicken fried steak and smothered pork chops. Everything was delicious - fresh and cooked to perfection. All the sides an cornbread were great.

9ab-0mv-hBuwb5tArvupnA.text: Whoever's got the Gold makes the rules and Mrs. White makes gold in that kitchen.  While I'm pretty sure that's not the golden rule Mrs. White is talking about, I think this one is more fitting! Her Smothered Chicken Fried Steak, dripping in gravy might as well have been dripping in gold, it tasted awesome! I ordered mine up with Mac N Cheese and Sweet Potatoes, deciding on those over the okra and the collard greens was tough, but worth it.  Unless you're on one of those reverse diet plans eating a minimum number of calories like an Olympic swimmer, you had better check you diets at the door; this ain't no place for calorie countin'. I told mine I was going out for a light jog on my lunch that day; "You really don't need to come along." I told her; I hope she bought it!   The ambiance here is likened more to a waffle house experience than 5 star dining, with old school fast food type booths and seating. While you're here, read the wall closely enough, and you will find many Cool signatures penned right on to it. Famous musical entertainers, local and nationally accomplished athletes, and other famed diners can all be found to have dined here once upon a time.  Our waitress was surprisingly fit and trim for someone who serves food at a Soul Food spot. I had to ask, "Just how do you keep that girlish figure while working and dining here?" which she replied with "running back and forth with orders all day" and "hiking my favorite trails" on her off days. I have to note that she is now my new inspiration. Maybe I need to get a job here. I wonder how that would go over for my diet plan? Hmmmm.  Happy Yelping Phoenix, it's time to go for gold!

XXnN-NWvOFyO1_PdlpvcJQ.text: I've eaten at Mrs Whites 3 times and every time the food was amazing and the service was friendly. I got my old co-workers hooked on this place. They were shocked by how good the food was.They continue to come to Mrs. Whites till this day. The fried chicken is the best I've every tasted.

pfs1_17WhyDBthdoL6kKhw.text: A colleague and I had lunch here recently.  We were both confused when the 'sandwich' he ordered off the menu was brought out; the fish was breaded but no sliced bread (explains why I didn't rate it 5 stars.  Really it's more like 4.5 stars).  Apparently the fish was good though!  I'd ordered the smothered pork chops with black eyed peas and coleslaw for sides.  To use Guy's terminology, both the chops & the gravy were "On point!".  The same could be said for the coleslaw ~ it had a great kick to it!  The peas were good, but not outstanding (can you make them outstanding?  I'm not so sure.).  Will be returning with The Boyfriend to try other options.    And have more of that coleslaw.

YXdnEYsgyKwfRk4asESDFw.text: Heard a lot about this place so decided to to it for myself. 2 words - never again. First of all, there was a sign that said "Parking $1 plus $9 Tip."  I don't know if it was a joke or serious but I was NOT parking there. I parked on the street. When I go inside, the place is empty. (I'm not going to go into detail about the horrible decor)  The hostess gave me a menu since I wanted it To Go, but also gave me a book of oils... Hustling OILS as I looked over the overpriced menu. Wow. Ghet-to.  The meals were $13 for an entree and 2 sides. I got the smothered chicken with gravy on the side, black eyed peas and rice, and macaroni and cheese. After waiting about 30 minutes for my $15 meal, I left. (They forgot my gravy. I went back for it)  The Meal: Chicken was incredibly fatty. Lots of parts I could not eat. The black eyed peas and rice were flavorless. No seasoning. No salt. The macaroni and cheese was clearly BOXED! Cheap, sad excuse for a soul food restaurant to have boxed soupy Mac and cheese. The meal came with cornbread which was hard and heavy and absolutely inedible. Overall, I was very disappointed with my meal and the service I received from Mrs White's. I'm not fond of LoLos either but I would GLADLY eat there before spending another dime at Mrs White's. The search for good soul food in Phoenix continues...

photos.caption: Photo of Mrs White's Golden Rule Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Definitely not worth $15. Flavorless. Disappointing.
Photo of Mrs White's Golden Rule Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States

4fxnPjOEgv0oF90CgXYw3w.text: We called in an order from Scottsdale and when we arrived we were not pleased. Not only was our order not ready, they were out of the item we ordered - chicken fried steak. When we chose the second option, the fried fish, we were told they were out of that option too. The owner was at the store shopping. Jamal told us that we could get a steak burger so we agreed. After offering free drinks while we waited, we paid and left. When we checked our order in the car, the order that was ready was incorrect. We ordered the three piece chicken dinner with an extra piece on the side. We went back into the store only to be told that we weren't charged for the chicken and that we'd have to wait... Again. Jamal came out of the kitchen and asked if we wanted a big wing... That's not what we asked for. After waiting an additional 15 minutes to cook one piece of chicken, Jamal tells the waiter, from the kitchen, that we didn't pay the $2.50 for the piece of chicken.... Like are you serious??? Jamal then told us that he had to cook in the kitchen because the cook had to pick up her kid from school... Like we didn't have plans....  Not only did they get out order wrong, we had to wait TWICE and they had the NERVE to ask for an additional $2.50?!?!   I really like Mrs. White's but this is THE worst service I've experienced.  Lessons learned:  1. Don't order ahead. 2. Check your order. 3. If you place a to go order, make sure you know what they are serving THAT day.

LoIc-zSuFbjg6-7kVVQo1A.text: There's something about Mrs. White's that no other place has.  It's not something you can bottle up and sell.  It's the love they put into every meal.  I have to tell you... when a friend suggested we go to Mrs. White's yesterday when our plans were changed, I was ecstatic.  I had not been in quite awhile.  I could already imagine myself eating those green beans and potatoes, sweet potatoes and fried chicken.    Once we got there, that is exactly what I ordered!    I could tell, too, that my chicken was made with an extra side of love.  It was phenomenal.    The people that don't like Mrs. White's don't get it.  I heard a lady complaining yesterday about how long her food was taking.  It kind of made me smirk.  Food this good is cooked to order... and takes time.  I knew it would be a long wait for our food, but I wasn't on a lunch hour.  I feel like anyone who is on a lunch hour might be better served hitting Mrs. White's another time.    The people there are all great.  If you take the time to talk to the people who work there, you will see how nice they are.  We got to talk to "Wink" about how he got his nickname from his grandma in St. Louis.  I told him about how I got my nick name, too.    I love Mrs. White's and I hope to visit again soon.

uYN4QURlPiZG0_hzcAPDhQ.text: My family and I ate there today. The chicken was okay. What I did like about the chicken....it was not greasy. What I didn't like, no flavor. We weren't told until after we ordered that they were out of macaroni and cheese and coleslaw . They brought us cornbread with no honey. The service was less than average. They took our order for drinks but did not bring them in a timely fashion. We then placed our order. While waiting we asked for refills . We had no napkins or forks at our table. We had asked the person who refilled our drinks but he never came for them. As we ate the cornbread we had to wipe our hands on our pants due to ,no napkins. Our food finally came but as the people who brought our food were leaving we asked for napkins and forks. My daughter in law ordered pork chops but the plate came with no knife. The server did come immediately to bring forks and napkins but we said we needed a knife. No knife came. We're eating and enjoying our food and a server came to the area for another table as she was leaving we asked for a knife. No knife was coming because this server started waiting on another table. my husband then gave his knife he had been eating his chicken fried steak with so she could eat her pork chop. Then he finally went to the front to get a knife. Just because you are a Phoenix staple from back in the 60's does not mean service should lack. It seems unorganized. The only reason I am giving it two stars is because my daughter in law and husband said the pork chop was tasty, the green beans and potatoes were good, so was the catfish. I know inside is dated but it was like you were stepping back in time. My suggestion would be for the staff to take a trip to Amy Ruth's in Harlem. Eat there for breakfast , lunch and dinner and take note of the food, the cleanliness, customer service, and organization of the staff.

GiW93apq1ltBq_mShExVbw.text: All the food was really tasty, friendly waitstaff, and the flavoring was amazing. The only downside I have is that it took a long time for them to deliver one of the meals.

joYDX0-wimsPD9Tj3-sIPw.text: I truly loved this place.  The people are so friendly and it reminded me of being in New Orleans in terms of the food and the attitude of the place.  It's not the cleanest restaurant but it has charm and authenticity.  I had the fried chicken which was delicious.  My friend had the chicken fried steak which was also great.  There are no soft drinks other than lemonade and sweet southern tea.  If you like southern comfort food in a very casual and friendly atmosphere then this is your place.

photos.caption: Photo of Mrs White's Golden Rule Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mrs. White must be quite lady.  93 years old and still going strong.
Photo of Mrs White's Golden Rule Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fried Chicken, black eyed peas, green beans and a potato.

Ra8rgs7A21x9efKdEYCkFQ.text: Mrs. Whites food is awesome. Homecooked meals, all delicious and mouthwatering. Service can be a little slow at times, but it's worth the wait, so if you don't have any patience in waiting for your made to order amazing food, then you may want to go when you have time. It's a very small place so you may want to take that into consideration if you are going with a large party. Only complaint, is that one waitress messed up on my drink order and forgot to bring us our corn bread (which is amazing btw). I didn't bother to mention my drink order mix up because it was getting pretty packed and she seemed overwhelmed, so I drank my lemonade that was supposed to be tea. Which was good too, so I didn't mind. I give the food an A+++, Waitservice (on this day) C-.  I'll always go back when I'm craving homecooked southern/soul food.

q2x7Iy4BQeWU_akQ9gclDw.text: It's a shame I'm not allowed to leave NO STARS because that is what this joint deserves.  Mrs. White's Golden Rule Cafe isn't "golden rule" at all because if this group of people came to my place, I'd feed them better and treat them friendlier then they ever did me.   After the New Times Best of 2011 came out, this place won(!) and  I made note to visit the place soon and  the best it got all night were two female dishwashers, in the parking lot, smoking, who could not have been nicer with their welcome.  But that, my friend, is as good as it got.  The waitress, and calling her a waitress demeans all perfectly good servers across the valley, she would not get up from her seat at the counter to serve me!  She merely slid the menu across the counter to me and said, in a very unfriendly voice, whaddya havin'?  The owner sat behind the counter counting his money -- SERIOUSLY -- and bragged to no one listening how he'd seen the same Casino-B Act three times in a day the day before.  Wow.  The chicken came, it was good.  I paid $21 for a plate of fried chicken, all white meat, black-eyed peas and another memorable side I cannot recall.  They were out of mashed potatos.  HOW DO YOU RUN OUT OF MASHED POTATOES?  OH, WAIT, WATCHING A B-LIST CASINO ACT 3 TIMES IN A DAY MIGHT TAKE AWAY FROM KITCHEN PREP DUTIES, NO?!!!!!  I told my friend on the way home what a scam that was.  I said one original recipe whole breast from KFC would be as good or better.  We stopped at the next KFC...and I was right!  $2.47 for one whole breast from KFC vs. $21 --- PER PERSON! -- at Mrs. White's.  STAY WAY AWAY FROM MRS. WHITES!  This guy, this family should get down on their hands and knees, every night and thank God for Jerry Colangelo, the Diamondbacks and the gentrification of their neighborhood.  It allows, at least, a couple of casino shows per night!  The sycophants who've written before me must want to misinform you:  DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY.  I WASTED MY MONEY FOR YOU!  update 1/20/13-a private message from Tony accuses me of racism.  Really?  What did I say here that was racist?  That I didn't like the food?  That's not racist.  That's the food. That the owner was counting his money?  Again, not racism.  The only thing racist here is Tony.  The food here is VASTLY OVERRATED!  I'M TELLING YOU, EL POLLO LOCO has better chicken than this DUMP, by FAR!  And you don't have watch an extremely fat waitress refuse to get up...oh, wait.  She can't.  She's too fat.  9/8/2018-dirty kitchen. See Photo Maricopa County Health Department:  GRADE: D. D!!'

photos.caption: Photo of Mrs White's Golden Rule Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Grade D. Lazy.

-Yb73FWc2JRYVUfLLjP5Tw.text: Served Southern style meat + 2 sides. Very good fried chicken and I like the veggies better than those at LoLo's. Very nice wait staff but haphazard service. No rhyme or reason to order taking, bread delivery. Some served cornbread immediately upon arrival, but I had to ask for some 10 minutes after food delivered. Waited 20 minutes before tea arrived and 30 before food arrived. Still, I would come back. Interesting that you walk up to cash register in front and tell the guy what you got. Really old school. But that's another reason I like it here. Just be prepared to wait.

XpvIobDWX59vyFL_AniXVA.text: This is nice hole in the wall with a lunch counter place. The menu is solid soul food. The mixed greens and sweet potatoes were ok but that cornbread was great!! I wanted the cabbage but it wasn't ready when I ordered :(. The fish that I tasted on my friend's plate could have used more seasoning. Rice and gravy needed more seasoning too. If I ever come back to Phoenix, which I probably won't I would try a different restaurant. But if you are close to airport and want some soul food this a place to try out.

5BJUEnoYh-kWgtICY7dPKQ.text: I am Southern, born and raised. This was the best fried chicken I have ever eaten outside of my mom's kitchen.  The vegetables were delicious   We were too full to try any of the desserts.  Amazing that the best Southern food I've eaten in a restaurant was in Arizona!

g4lhOFH8Flv8v5CMKK0UBQ.text: AmaIn food fast service great environment amazing woman killing it service wonderful I will be backing

5joS3KGAuVvp9aaRCkYrpA.text: When I first discovered this Cafe, I thought it was a typical Diner Cafe. You know, breakfast and brunch type foods. When me and my son arrived we discovered it was far from that. But it was a pleasant surprise. Their food is downright delicious! I had their catfish the first time I was there and I was in heaven besides that I got were greens, cabbage, and sweet potatoes , yes I got three sides. The second time I was there I wanted to order catfish but they were out. That is the reason for the four stars. I feel like a restaurant should be eat fully stocked at least till a couple hours before closing time. But I got the fried chicken instead. And it was just as delicious. If you're in the mood for soul food and good soul food you will have to check out this Cafe.

2wJcABgrk8s15hUho6DFRw.text: Go. Go here and eat. For more than 50 years this place has served up smothered pork chops, oxtail, fried chicken, cabbage, perfectly seasoned green beans, fried okra that isn't too hard to eat and the most moist cornbread I ever ate.   Everything you could ever want at a soul food place and made with the hands of someone who knows what a "pinch of this" and a "dash of that" means without a measuring spoon.   The board behind the long counter has the available plate dinners and sides. Get the smothered pork chops. Near perfect thin little pork pieces of heaven! The cabbage is melt in your mouth leaves of joy. I honestly felt like I had been to Sunday dinner after church with ladies who wear big hats...ya know?  It's a low ceiling little joint with autographs and framed pictures of famous clients and newspaper write ups on the walls. It's just a hole in the wall slice of delicious everything you could want in a mom and pop place that's been an institution in Phoenix for 5 decades.  Did I say go here and eat already? Then why aren't you there?

photos.caption: Photo of Mrs White's Golden Rule Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Smothered pork chops

rc5lFX_KlMb24VJ90z-aLg.text: Second time here was just as good as the first. Still the usual bike in the wall place, family owned and operated for more than 50 years. It's not a very big place, but people will stop in for lunch if they are working in the city. Lunch for a quick bite while out and about in the city will also work here.  I had the fried chicken, which is the signature dish here, along with cabbage and red beans. The chicken was crispy, tasty, and had plenty of meat for flavor. I think they even add the kicky flavor to it, which I admire. The cabbage is an automatic 5 Stars. It was delicious, cooked well, and probably some of the best cabbage I've had in a while. And the red beans and rice had a bit of a creamy flavor to them, but good nonetheless. Great lunch plate!  The cornbread could've been a bit better since it was a little hard, but it had good flavor. I also had a bite of the green beans, which were more flavorful than some others I've had in the past. The sides list is pretty expansive, so poke around for what you want.  They also have check marks on the food meaning they are fresh out. Usually around lunch time is when they get busy so get here early so you won't miss out. Getting here can be a bit difficult, since the rail is in the middle of the street, but there is plenty of parking in the back. Come on down for some good soul food for lunch!

VfwHCD26_qaUzFxD-5KNUg.text: Very unique place, been in business for over 55 years. Mrs. Whites Golden Rule Cafe, sits on E Jefferson downtown Phoenix.  If you blink you'll miss it.  For down home cooking I recommend coming here, soulfood in the valley has been hard to fine. But after trying this place trust me it's good. Small and relaxing, they keep it simple with good results.    I'm very impressed with my Catfish dinner w/Sweet Potatoes  & Red Beans w/rice, cornbread was hot out the oven, and Red Koolaid.  This is what soulfood suppose to be. Not complex but simple and good.  You're able to write your name and comments on the wall, has a lot of history here.  If you're in the area please make sure to stop by and try them. You won't be disappointed!!!!

bM8gfRUxV7bTejgoqJEEGQ.text: This place has really good fried chicken. I wanted to try the oxtail but they didn't have any. Then I wanted to try the catfish and they also didn't have any. But their fried chicken was delicious and they have a lot of sides. They were out of cabbage and okra, so I had to go for green beans and rice.... Ok so basically what I'm saying is come early cause once they run out, they run out....  Came here around 2PM and it was exceptionally ... filthy. Dirty. I feel bad saying so. Sat down to grab a seat and it took a while before they cleaned off our table, we even "bussed" our table to help make things go quicker. Kool-aid was crazy sweet. They forgot to give us cornbread so they gave it to us to-go since I asked for it at the register. They didn't have a pen for me to sign my receipt so they said don't worry about it but when I said I wanted to tip they went looking for one, and a pen should be available at the register, esp when you're about to pay for your food! It was just so disorganized.   As for the food, the fried chicken was good, but nothing of my sides were hot. Lukewarm at most. Red beans were not good at all. Rice was decent because it had no flavor. I wish I could have opted for other sides.   SAVING GRACE: HOT SAUCE. Laddle it on.

Am9UrKhzzTE6ZE0BnHzLGw.text: Alton Brown is what brought us to try Mrs. White's.  If he says it's the best fried chicken, then it's gotta good!  We came in on a Sunday right as they opened and were greeted by the friendly staff.  She gave us menus and also helped us with recommendations.  There was a group of 8 of us, and we wanted to try everything!  The chicken was lightly coated with a great seasoning, cooked perfectly.  From what I understand, she has a small fryer in the kitchen so it's cooked in small patches.  This means your getting it fresh and hot.  It hasn't been sitting around for hours.  The sides were delicious as well.  Honestly, some of the best greens I've ever had!  Corn bread, mac and cheese, green beans and black eyed peas...oh my!  Everything was sooo tasty and its all served up with sweet tea.  For desert we had sweet potato pie and I telling you, I thought I had gone to heaven.  We hit this place up on the way to the airport. If you're ever in Phoenix area or even passing through, check this place out!

photos.caption: Photo of Mrs White's Golden Rule Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Delicious side dishes...by this time the chicken had been devoured! Sorry that I don&#39;t have photos to share.

IeX_HMQqSZ5ZFxnssnCsLA.text: There are places in this world where you look at them and you know that you have arrived at what you were seeking.  I love how like half the complaints aren't about the food, it's that the inside is kinda trashy. Well, come on, did you see the outside?  The treasure lies behind the line, and there's a lot of choices but they have legendary catfish, and I mean legendary generally not legendary for Arizona. (Arizona is not known for catfish. Sorry, folks, gotta break it to ya...)  The greens are solid. I wish I knew how they made them so smoky without meat, and the only hint I got was "you gotta use butter."  Welllllllllllllll I will figure this out.   But the catfish, oh the catfish, a little sweet and mild, the kind of flavor you only get from well-raised catfish. Perfectly seasoned, not oily in the slightest. The fried chicken is as good, too...but fried chicken is easy. Catfish is not. Catfish must be handled with love and care.   Theirs is.  Other highlights: solid potato salad and creamy sweet cole slaw. Sweet potatoes are heavenly.   I know they have red drink but I'm all about that iced tea. Half sweet half not. Nothing goes down your gullet faster on a hot day in Phoenix.   Can be a little slow if it's bumping. Doesn't matter, worth every second of wait and every penny you pay.  Don't miss this place.  PS: Cornbread.

M1kabD7JdtJ6OjiUe_CsEA.text: Whenever I crave the best southern fried chicken in Arizona, I head to Mrs. White's Golden Rule. I cannot describe how awesome the chicken is. I've never ordered anything else, but my companions say the smothered pork chops are tasty. Make sure you order the collard greens and black-eyed peas with the chicken. The sweet tea is a must with any meal. They cook each dish fresh, so be prepared to wait a while.

rbPObSr2lmr4KZTUdB1zoA.text: Mrs. White's is an iconic downtown staple.  During our early years of marriage, I worked across the street as a clerk.  I would  often dine here on Friday's as a treat when I got paid.  I distinctly remember smelling all that chicken cooking on that greasy cauldron somewhere in the back. It was always calling out my name. The chicken, along  with the generous portion of corn bread, enlivened my otherwise boring, office. clerical experience.   Fast forward to one particular Sunday when we happened to be driving around downtown phoenix. We wanted to relive our "golden years" and decided to revisit Mrs White's.  What's not to like about this place? It's unshakable.  It's stalwart even.   You might even say it's predictable.  They serve great fried chicken. They also serve hearty pork chops, when they have them.  For sides they have great sweet beans and corn bread.  Their lemonade is to die for.  However, much of what we remembered and were expecting didn't quite come to pass. On our visit they were all out of chops and there weren't enough beans. The chicken / corn bread portions were measly in comparison to what we so distinctly remember. To add to the disappointment,  their prices were much higher. If I were to look back at what it cost to eat here now versus back then, I could not have afforded to have lunch here with my measly paychecks.  In any case, the portions that we did receive were quite spicy and oh so delectable. While they were all out of desserts when we first walked in, they must have seen our crestfallen expressions, because somehow chocolate cake magically appeared. Nonetheless, we left  disappointed because of the meager quantity that they now serve, even if it is the same great quality we remember.   Maybe times are tough. I'm not sure. But I'm still quite certain that they still have one of the best fried chickens in town.

alYwrz1aGxI149Kifnmgkg.text: I love this place for the foods. But oh my goodness the service is absolutely terrible! The make you wait forever. They get you order wrong. They forget to bring people at your table their order. They are rude and the place is filthy.

cZmJfO69TcUoQTn_7hr_yg.text: This is by far my favorite soul food restaurant in the valley!!!  A lot of people will tout Lo Lo's as the best, but in my opinion, they are mistaken and are being swayed by Lo Lo's ambiance.  Mrs. White's is bare-bones, straight-to-the-point soul food.   This place is super busy on Sunday as there is a church right next door, so I would recommend going before church lets out.

Oae287Dq552Oap91v8C2AQ.text: I really love Mrs. White's! The staff truly treats you like you're part of the family and the food is full of SOUL.  The southern fried chicken is perfectly seasoned and cooked. The meat is juicy and the skin is crispy. My mouth is watering just thinking about it.  I also tried the catfish, which was surprisingly good when you consider Arizona is not known for seafood.  Let's talk sides:  The Mac is delicious. It has a bit of a kick to it, making is way better than the boring Mac at other establishments. The cabbage was awesome and green beans were also good. I like a good amount of salt and didn't have to add a pinch! The coleslaw is some of the best I've had. Finally, the cornbread. OMG it doesn't even fall apart and was buttered perfectly.  To end the meal I had the peach cobbler. It came out pipping hot and was an awesome mix of fruit, cinnamon and crust. I wish I had taken it to-go because I was so full I couldn't finish and would have loved to have a scoop of ice cream on top.  DO NOT drive passed this old, yellow building. The soul inside deserves to be witnessed.

_6SNWs6AhZQv7hQMcZGabQ.text: While the food was good, the service was not.  Sunday evening, near closing time. Must have been the B team. Certainly was not the best time for customers, but that should not cause bad service. Mrs. White would not approve.

UtI6uGTcfEnv5emxM2ahaA.text: I cannot speak to the experience others have had but for me - lawd Jesus this food is GOOD! I've had the fried catfish, black eyed peas, cabbage and corn bread. Planning soon to return and try the fried chicken and smothered pork chops.
